-3odjADDMFmsw8ERj1bNTw.text: The food tasted great, but my burger was more of a meatball than a patty. Eating it was a physical challenge which was a shame because it was so good when it finally engaged my taste buds. The service was so-so. I felt like the place was trying so hard to be hip that it was going to have an seizure. The details about it being very loud are not kidding. Do not go if you are looking for a quiet place to chat.

74tY4RQQxjqCqfrhKEDnfQ.text: We had dinner at the outsider on a bit of a whim, not having been able to book any other nice restaurants on our only dinner night in edinburgh. We'd booked for 20:00, but showed up at 19:00 and they had a table for us. A lovely one, in the back, with a view of the castle. The menu is simple, and everything looks delicious. Every single dish i saw coming out of the kitchen, I wanted to taste. Everything we had tasted amazing. For the first time in my life, I left the potato skins on as I ate the hand-cut chips. The whipped cream that came with the chocolate cake was made with molasses. For the first time ever, I did not ignore the cream. I ate it. It, too, was delicious.   With a flagon of wine one entree to share, a main dish for each and a dessert to share, our bill came to about 60 for the both of us. Given how delicious the food was, we were ready to pay more.    The next day, as we chatted with our host back at the house we rented a room at for the night, we discovered that he and his staff all strongly recommended the outsider, and that another couple staying there had also dined there the night before, as happily as us.    I'm already looking forward to going back to the outsider for dinner. And I live a five-hour train ride away. Yes, it's that good.

2oEV9wK7PEgoTosRYpXgOA.text: Came in for a late lunch on a Sunday, sat in a lovely cozy corner spot.  Excellent food, got to sit with my book and rest for a while after a lot of walking and touristing.   Menu apparently changes all the time, I had one of the specials and it was delicious.  Excellent chocolatey dessert as well.

Fw50OVXNTFkzLG7psacEYw.text: One of my most favourite, favourite restaurants in Edinburgh. I can't even remember the amount of times I've been here, but I'm suspicious that they inject the beetroot coleslaw that comes with the chunky healthy lines dishes with some kind of addictive ingredient, that makes you desire pink strips of amazing coleslaw day and night. I'll be highly surprised if anybody else is weird enough to have beetroot coleslaw cravings, but there we go.   You can rely on several things about The Outsider. It's always busy, and therefore has a great atmosphere, the food is consistently tasty and brilliant, and it's effortlessly cool and style laden at all times. It's also reasonably priced, so you can have a few glasses of wine plus some food without worrying too much.   The Outsider always has a really good feel about it, and it has steadily remained popular over the years. I usually go for any of the chunky healthy lines, which are basically skewers speared with different food items, ranging from scallops, and salmon to lamb meatballs and chicken pieces. There are no official starters, as you're encouraged to share the CHLs, and there's a good variety of meat, seafood and veggie dishes on offer for main courses, and always served in pretty generous portions too.

UXF_xTDWOOSqL7x7wOsFWg.text: Three of us had a late lunch here and it was quite good. The cuisine is definitely not standard Scot food -- much more original. Staff was very friendly chatty, the atmosphere bright. Prices were medium high by my standards, 3 of us spent GBP 34.

3XW0z6VKUJRXJUpzHfrTOg.text: Excellent food and great wine list,  Only let down by slight over cooking and waitstaff forgetting I wanted the dessert menu. I always want dessert.

YHIt_Tu1-kVyXq_e9V6zeA.text: I went back to the Outsider recently for the first time since I graduated from Edinburgh University in 2005.  Luckily, it remained as good as I remembered.  The warm and lively atmosphere was a welcome break from the snowstorm outside, and immediately I started to feel at home.  A glass (it was lunchtime, or obviously we would have ordered a bottle!) of very nice and reasonably-priced pinot grigio later and I was feeling even better.  As I scanned the menu, all the great memories started to come back: from the CHLs (Chunky Healthy Lines - usually a kebab type thing with pitta, vegetables and dressing) to the yummy fries.  I ordered the lamb and venison stew which was mouthwateringly good.  My companion had the ribeye steak, which although not my favourite cut, was well-cooked and juicy.  And when I got the bill (unfortunately I was the one paying), it was definitely not an unpleasant surprise.  Well worth it for the quality of food and service.  Highly recommend and wish I still lived in Edinburgh so I could go here more often.

rs2z78txuPmKUKG0kcqKhA.text: Absolutely a delicious night. Our waiter was helpful in steering us toward excellent dishes and every moment of our meal was superb. Must must go. We may even go a second night in a row...

KOJW68RMM34lWyddLAF1Yg.text: It's a staple of Edinburgh dining, the menu does change regularly but only really the fish dishes. You can ALWAYS get a well cooked steak and chips. Garlic fries are boss, and so good infact that you could eat them on a date and your partner would understand. Seafood is always great and the CHL (I think?) are a great light bite, as they're chunky, healthy bits of veg and meat on kebab skewers.  You always read bad reviews about the owner and he is an unreasonable man, so just grow a pair and stand up to him, I've got no time for bullies so let's all unite eh?

5qPgs_M396NCzkqY2VcP5w.text: Again, still very good, but they never took my lighting suggestions on board!! what's up with that?!  the food still is amazing though, you cant deny that

cd59Ulixdbf9BBtrhq3mIw.text: Great venue and decor with a good view of the castle. The food is very good, I enjoyed the haddock with leeks, mash, sorrel sauce and a poached egg on top Yum! the bread is really good too. Everyone enjoyed their meal,  my friend got a bad rib eye but they happily replaced with a much bigger better one! It's not cheap but is worth it for a treat.

bCCOj6SB2pM5CCiXWCeIgA.text: The outsider seems to have scrubbed up nice since my last dine here ( a number of years ago). Confidently designed with its dark coal decor and stylish appeal, there's always the lingering doubt that its mere style over substance.  The Outsider seems to have the latter covered to a successful degree as the barnsley chops I tried, with a lovely goats cheese dauphinoise, was excellent. My opinion is admittedly complimented by a cracking view of Edinburgh castle available from the rear of the restaurant, making the whole experience unique to Edinburgh.  Worth a try.

photos.caption: Photo of The Outsider - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

pV76xLhOYKwqCz1oekAJ2Q.text: Love the way they present the food. Fantastic fish dishes. Good service.

Tkg933JUevWVMPjq40uI9g.text: CHL absolutely divine & plenty for dinner. We ordered side salads & they were unnecessary. Service slow & inattentive, which is quite un-Scottish.

hKse9A49IJAKVPKBXETvfA.text: Not particularly attentive staff, poorly cooked red snapper (batter like concrete), slow turnaround between order & service. Won't be back.

t-Uaq6mL0vri9TfLy44Enw.text: Worst meal I've had in Scotland, and I've lived here for almost a year. As The Outsider came highly recommended, this was a huge disappointment. We sat for ten or fifteen minutes before anyone took our drink order, after which all staff refused to meet our eyes and only came by to curtly drop off our meal. I ordered the gnocchi, and the only flavour it had was burnt - aside from the black on the weird, overly doughy "gnocchi" the dish was completely tasteless . My mom had the crab linguini, which tasted like seaweed and old fish. Even the drinks were bad - the prosecco was ill chosen, the kir royale was too sweet. All of this would be forgivable is the service wasn't so terrible - we sat with mostly uneaten but obviously finished plates for a while before we decided to get up and leave. Nobody checked with us or said thank you as we quietly paid and left. Truly terrible, and I'm pretty forgiving as I worked in restaurants for years.

D_dii1xiFXFOFn6uHQ5h4g.text: My new favourite restaurant (and I can be quite picky)!   It ticked all the boxes:   Great food (best vegetarian meal I have had in a long time) Polite and attentive staff (uber friendly but not too much) Lovely surroundings (Nice, trendy decor, tables lit by candlelight) Great atmosphere (busy but not too loud) Good location (By the castle and near other bars for after-dinner drinks) Good value (Very reasonable considering how scrum-diddly-umptious is was).   I'll definitely be going back!

TmwsH7QbTQprMOikcvX02w.text: I've eaten at the outsider a few times now and have never been have only ever had one complaint: get the raisins out of the damn coleslaw! (Who ever first thought of drying out perfectly good grapes to turn them into the vile thing that is a raisin is one sick puppy!!!)   Other than that the outsider is great; mains shared with a friend for a starter, good looking staff serving your food and you may even be lucky enough to get one of the tables with a view onto the castle.   And remember just say no to the raisins!!!

AAptn-0WXjZwPzcnDiriEg.text: Wow!  I'm amazed at some of the reviews here, I've always had a pleasant culenary experience at the Outsider but have found the service very intrusive. Will treat with caution! Ess

eduyYaOFIOvJ9QNfGaTgZw.text: We visited The Outsider for dinner on a Friday night after reading about it in the Wallpaper* guide to Edinburgh, and couldn't have been more thrilled with the atmosphere, service, food and price. Though a word of warning the portions are MASSIVE so don't even think about ordering sides. We made the mistake of ordering olives and bread for two to nibble on first, and were bowled over by the size of the olives and how beautifully oaty the bread was, which came with a serving of pesto olive oil. By the time our pork belly and seafood CHL (satay sticks with seafood and vegetables, and a beetroot and apple coleslaw pitta) came we were almost full, but shovelled down the food like it was the last thing we'd ever eat it was just too tasty not to. The garlicky fries were heaven too. I think the bill came to around 45 with a caraffe of wine as well, which was a very reasonable price considering the excellent night we had. For some photos and a more detailed review, you could always check out my blog post on The Outsider here if you fancy: katherinehannaford.com/2...

RFOLn7SPe1ZTMp_LZvCg2A.text: Great food! Amazing desert! Loved the vibe. Great server. This restaurant is a MUST if you are visiting Edinburgh! It's close the St Giles and the Castle, so it's not too hard to get to and enjoy a fantastic dinner!

photos.caption: Photo of The Outsider - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. This is the chocolate espresso pave. Heaven.

rKIncKElWvT9JsN0WmS-gg.text: The food was amazing! Everything we tried was a creative combo of ingredients and perfectly prepared. We had the pigeon breast starter - if you've never had pigeon, this is a great place to try it. Our mains were venison (best my husband had ever had) and dill tagliatelle (so unique). The staff was friendly. The value was incredible. The views of the Castle were a magical bonus. Highly recommend!

x4Q_y_BQNgsyjPGNgB33aQ.text: After hearing so much about The Outsider I just had to give it a try, so when a special occasion popped up it was first on my list. We went for an early dinner, but the place was hopping when we arrived! The staff took our coats which we later saw was a fantastic way to keep the place looking chic. We were brought upstairs to a table which overlooked the downstairs of the restaurant, though lacked a castle view. You can't have everything!   Since we'd booked an early table the staff had asked we return it by a certain time so we decided to skip the starters for some bread. The artisanal bread was delicious though I wasn't fond of the butter, it tasted a bit on the rancid side. The accompanying parsley and oil dip was also enjoyable.   We ordered a merlot with whole partridge for me, served with black pudding, pear and crushed potatoes, while opposite me steak and chips was the call of the day. The partridge was delicious, and everything on the plate went together wonderfully. I probably won't be ordering 'whole' anything in a restaurant anytime soon as my attempts to carve it up were bordering on ridiculous. Meanwhile the steak, which had been ordered 'medium' arrived quite pink inside which was a disappointment but we decided not worth a complaint.   After we had demolished our dinners we settled on a dram of whisky and some rum truffles for afters. Unfortunately we are both quite picky about desserts and none of those available really appealed to us. The truffles were delicious and quite heavy. There were six or so on the dish and I think 2 or 3 would be sufficient for anyone.  The staff are wonderful, very professional and conscientious. And all very good looking, just saying. The look of the place is halfway between rustic and modern. Candlelight provides  a good bit of the lighting in some areas while spotlights take over in others. The chairs are chunky and wooden and the lack of coats everywhere definitely shows off the design. The wooden floors and large windows give a modern look. Huge windows downstairs, complete with mirrors upstairs afford many patrons with a wonderful view of the castle which is lit beautifully at night.  A great meal and definitely one for the list you have friends and family visiting, or just for a nice night out!

photos.caption: Photo of The Outsider - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of The Outsider - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Lovely lamb!

nYCX1Zw40NoiV3WDJ26nlw.text: What a lovely restaurant recommended by our B&B. Meals are made from scratch with fresh local ingredients.  The place is in an unmarked building with a bicycle in front. Make sure you make reservations. The restaurant gets quite busy. We were only able to walk in to get a table because we arrived really early in the evening. We were put in the front in a comfy window booth. It felt private yet we still could see the rest of the restaurant. I think they have tables in the back with a spectacular view. Request one of those. I really enjoyed my mussel appetizer. My Pedro Ximeniez and dessert sampler were standouts as well. Eat here. You won't regret it.

i4YHoOz6Cq7ichgljjrxew.text: Absolutely LOVED my lunch here.   Had some amazing lamb meatballs and falafel on a freezing cold and windy day.   They sat me at a table with a view of the castle and I had a lovely glass of wine and the most surprising delicious lunch I could have asked for.   My only complaint would be that the day was so cold it was a little chilly by the old window.   Dress warm in Edinburgh in winter!!   I will definitely visit this restaurant again if I return to try the other dishes and maybe their dinner service.

5Zw-H3TWUwPqqw-3JC61hQ.text: If The Outsider was a person, he would be the friend that knows how to dress well, can put on khakis and a blazer and fix their hair all nice, and do a proper night out. That said, you know he's still too cool to take any of this too seriously, and you love him for it. He's secretly laughing at the two serious-looking people in suits sitting over there, even though they just ordered the exact same cheese board that you did, because you guys are going to enjoy it so much more.  PROTIP: There is one perfect, lovely table on the second floor that faces a window which overlooks the castle. Try to reserve this table for the perfect experience. We had the one next to it which was still lovely.  [ vibe ] Proper enough to justify the menu prices without feeling overbearingly fancy. A suit wouldn't be out of place, but definitely not required. Romantic. Perfect for a date / night out, if you don't want to scare the girl with 40 entrees but want to show that you're still taking this seriously. Cozy, dark, chic, modern, while still feeling the rustic charm of Edinburgh.  [ food ] We started with the cheese board and wine. Good mix and serving sizes - brie, comte, and blue, with ample compote, grapes, and crackers. Can't remember what mains we ordered (there was some kind of sweet potato gnocchi in there). Not striking, but sufficiently delicious. You will walk out full.  [ value ] Two pound signs, but definitely a three pound sign vibe. Prices are more than reasonable for the service and quality of food that you get.  [ cherry on the cake ] I accidentally left my phone (with a Mondrian-themed case) in the bathroom - by the time I realized and called the restaurant it was already late and we had settled into bed, so the cheery gentleman on the phone said to just come back the next morning. "Just say that Paul put it in the small safe, and name the artist who did the painting on the back". Grabbed it the next day and had a nice chat. Lovely people.  [ conclusion ] A solid choice for a good night out, run by good human beings. Definitely give it a go the next time you feel like wining and dining.

E2S1bB84lHMQHyTFl7SwJA.text: The Outsider has a great view of the castle as well as the rest of Edinburgh if you can manage to grab a seat near the windows. I came for lunch with a friend and ordered the rabbit pie and burger, respectively. Everything was new to me as it's my first time in Scotland, but the rabbit pie was very good and made me glad I tried it! My friends burger was also delicious, as was the bread we ordered on the side. The bread was accompanied by a green sauce that I really loved, but they didn't spill on the ingredients haha. Everything else on the menu and the other plates that fellow diners were having seemed great!

photos.caption: Photo of The Outsider - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. The rabbit pie
Photo of The Outsider - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. The rabbit pie

jvBpE7HtpdAh3O_7qvJVTQ.text: Tried The Outsider for lunch a couple of days ago, it's been on my list for a while and I was visiting Edinburgh for the day during the festival so had the perfect excuse.   We had a reservation and thank god we did because this place was mobbed! There was a wait time of 25 minutes when we showed up. We had requested a window seat because of the beautiful views of the castle, and having booked a week and a half before our visit I was sure we would have snagged one, but unfortunately not. Hopefully next time!   Really great menu variety, with a smaller portioned lunch section at great prices, and then a full al a carte menu also. I ended up going for the gnocchi with beets and goats cheese, and my boyfriend had  hake which was also served with gnocchi. The gnocchi wasn't the usual you could buy from the supermarket or are served at an average Italian joint, but instead they were like large potato dumplings. Really, really nice and not overly chewy like some gnocchi can be.   Great wine list, with superior wines at fab prices. We settled for a French Picpoul which I would definitely look for again.   We chose the rhubarb pannacotta for dessert which was okayish. Would choose something else next time. We tried to order a couple of Pedro Ximenez for an after dinner drink, which unfortunately they were out of but the waiter recommends a really delicious alternative.   I'll definitely return to the outsider another time, maybe when the festival is over and it's not so manic, but all in all a really great place.

rsy-GXE715zj-SJ5wWczwA.text: Absolutely lovely.   The CHL (Chunky Healthy Lines) are where its at. The name (at first) threw me a bit. Chunky and Healthy? In a line? I do not understand. But with a bit of explanation I came to learn these were juicy, tender skewers of multiple varieties (I had the monkfish), accompanied by lovely sides (think sweet potato, pita with cabbage slaw, etc). Delightful, filling and...indeed, healthy!   Sides: roasted kale (with a kick, whew!) and the walnut apple salad (really nice).   The foggy mist created a "ghost castle" effect -- very beautiful view from the back of the restaurant's windows. The lighting and ambience are subtle, yet...perfect. Candlelit, clean rustic feel that is both contemporary and classic feeling at once. Comfortable. The din never too loud, but always cheerful. Tables turned all evening. The staff is gorgeous and competent.   Dessert: a fresh plum tart with spicy ginger ice cream. Heavenly   Not a missed step all evening, perhaps they could've upsold me another glass of Forge Mill rose (light and frivolous was the description -- indeed!) had they asked --- but this only allowed me to save room for an espresso martini, which propelled me through the rest of the evening, night and into the morning...as it turns out!   Will surely return when in the area -- a real treat.

photos.caption: Photo of The Outsider - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Monkfish CHL

YG50_PaFBSvbKdDl0N14vQ.text: We went for lunch, got a cheese platter and entrees and good lord, some of the best food I've ever had! The lunch menu is so affordable, maybe more so than a lot of pubs. I had mint&pea gnocchi and it was just to die for. There is a view of the castle, but the whole place looks akin to an art gallery. I'm so in love with the place. And the waiter and manager were both great, charming but cool. It was great for lunch with my family but would also be a great date night spot too.   I'll probably come here for lunch every time I'm in Edinburgh if I can help it :)

eX-3KL00JQKUbP4yxZC4SA.text: I will start by saying that the food was quite delicious and the menu had exciting dishes to explore. The staff though was very unfriendly from the moment we walked in the door, and our waitress did not check on our table once and we had to go find her at the end to get our check. The host was also very clipped and rude. If I am going to go out for dinner, I don't want to just have a great meal but also a great atmosphere.

jTrmP72nq9c8cxEIq8f0YQ.text: I can't believe I had never been to the Outsider after all these years in the Burgh!  Anyway, went for dinner with some friends in January.  Were given a table with view on the castle (can't beat that!).  The food was excellent (got the venison haunch which was melt-in-the-mouth and a delicious frangipane-based pudding), the wine was good too.  They didn't rush us when we lingered after dinner to finish our second bottle of wine, but then it was January and the middle of the week so the place wasn't exactly packed!  The only reason I'm giving 4 stars is because I've only had one meal there, and I was with a regular. But a very happy surprise I have to admit!  Highly recommended.

y0fcnH7x8iajbJ2x3InYHQ.text: We selected the restaurant based on the menu and the ambiance - disappointed with the service.  Terrible service by indifferent staff who don't give a crap.  Appalling!    After plopping down a jug of water, our waiter disappeared for 15 minutes and since we sitting around a corner I decided to get up and notify the maitre'd that we were ready to order.  Judging by how long it took us to put in our order, we requested our starter and mains be brought out together so as not to make an even bigger production out of dinner. After 45 minutes and witnessing a table who arrived after us receive their starters, we asked for the bill bc we were fed up. The waiter agrees to bring the check but after a few minutes comes up to notify us the food will be ready shortly and has the gall to stand at our table and quibble over the length of time we have waited!!! He argued it was 40 minutes of waiting rather than the 1hr we claimed (15 minutes to place an order + 45 minutes waiting for food)!!  After holding us captive for 1 hr in wait of our food, the maitre'd comes up with plates in hand as the waiter is debating wait time with us and says "oh ladies, what are we to do with all this food? It's up to you - you eat it or not.  The food takes time, we make it fresh..." blah blah blah - as if to insinuate we needed an education on fine dining. Let's not delude ourselves here - by no stretch of the imagination is this a fine dining establishment.  Admit someone fked up, or something went wrong, apologise and do better. Fine, we chose to eat it as it was already close to 9pm.  Why was this "freshly" made food luke warm??!    Now for the food - meh. My reaction is probably coloured by the tense atmosphere created in having to fight with the staff. Ox cheek starter - interesting, never had it with beans before. Gnocchi - I missed that it was described as "pan fried" so was not expecting little sticks of dry gnocchi with walnuts and pears.  The combination of ingredients contained a bit more salt than I'd prefer to eat, but it was tasty. Having just been to Tuscany a week ago, it would be a bit unfair to compare it to the pillowy soft texture of Italian gnocchi  Lamb rump - apart from it being luke warm, mum said it was fine.   We did finish all of our food though, and it was OK but I probably would've said the same for any food at that point.  Would I ever go back - not a chance in hell!  Thankfully, we were not charged service or I really would have lost the plot.

Dh-W-TLx2v8v7z4UoLfNZQ.text: We were looking for something different from the standard pub fare and the wife looked at the menu from outside and suggested this place.  The place is very modern, but with a classy warm look to it.  We were sat in a corner window seat which was fine because it drowned out the noise from the rest of the restaurant.  Our server was a young lady and she was helpfully in picking our food and making suggestions.  The food was very good, the wife ordered the lamb which was almost as amazing as our recent Indian restaurant and I ordered the steak, which also was very good.   Overall the dining experience was very good until the end.  We had arrived there about 1.5 hour from them closing.  Our waitress had completely disappeared and I had finished all of my water and my drink.  Since I noticed we had another 20 minutes I had wanted another glass of wine, but no one wanted to come over.  I grab the attention of another waiter cleaning the place up and he came over to assist. Let me tell you there were still about 6 people in the place with no signs of them leaving at all.  Being that it was 5 minutes before the closed ( I waited 15 minutes to get someone's attention) I just asked for the check and inquired on our waitress.  The waiter said she went home, but told him to take care of us; then why did no one come and check on us. Overall the food was very good, the prices were good, and the serve right up to the end was above average.  I would have rated them 4 stars with no problem had someone been around to assist us at the end of the meal.

kYqn_hD9wsi4Ka6QlEW85g.text: Basic interior (on purpose), super atmosphere (a little loud), great food for a very reasonable price.  With a rather large group we got to sit at the attic which is open on one side so we were separate from the rest of the restaurant but did not feel too much apart.  The Scottish beef and lamb are great and the hot plum dessert was excellent.   Great whiskeys ;-)

b4v10O7OAckF6YZXtlr8NQ.text: Wow. Found this in old NY times article about Edinburgh. Chic in old Georgian building. Wine list very thorough with the most interesting wine list description ever. The meal was scrumptious. Maybe try for reservation and get lucky for table overlooking the castle. Ambience perfect.

photos.caption: Photo of The Outsider - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Beautiful view of Edinburgh Castle at sunset.

c8BFfQ7qBhWaOElCxDlLhA.text: After moving to Edinburgh, I had heard so many great things about the Outsider that it stood out in my mind as an alluring, perfect restaurant with a great atmosphere, stunning views, friendly staff, and outstanding food. With building suspense, I visited the Outsider for the first time tonight with my boyfriend and my parents, and it fully lived up to my expectations!   I had the grilled monkfish skewers with rolled bacon and grape tomatoes, with salad and a fantastic beetroot coleslaw (I'm not usually a slaw person but this was amazing). My mother's salmon was perfect and plentiful, grilled with sweet beetroot and piled high with a salad. My boyfriend liked his porkbelly with scallops, and my father liked his mackerel (although the mackerel was a bit of a small portion compared to the other dishes, we had more than enough food with plenty of salmon and monkfish). We had a candle-lit table by the window with fantastic views of the castle and a lovely dinner together here!  Although a treat and a bit more expensive than I would spend on everyday meals, they were absolutely delicious and also had great lunch / early evening deals (6.50) lasting until 7pm for those with tighter budgets.

photos.caption: Photo of The Outsider - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. The Scottish salmon was perfect
Photo of The Outsider - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. The monkfish was amazing

lnKWXkeDm_kBaN4dmCIaew.text: Exceptional food and charming service. Portions are large and options are varied so everyone can find something to enjoy. Venison was cooked to perfection, served with roasted veggies and a carrot puree which I wish there had been more of it was so good. Started with the braised ox cheek and knew right away we had chosen wisely. Soft, succulent and full of flavor. Large portion for a starter, too. Skewered spiced lamb balls with merguez were spicy and smokey. Portion was twice what we were expecting, but we finished it all because we simply couldn't bear to leave any behind. Good wine list, lovely modern space with big windows and clean lines. Right on a main street, but when you step in it has an intimate feel despite being a larger restaurant. Two glasses of wine, a beer, two appetizers, and two entrees, along a side totaled $75 US. Great value for the caliber of the food. Excellent spot for a romantic dinner.

v4gVgAKthC_QWb8gcNnFZw.text: This was one of our favorite finds during our trip to Edinburgh. It took us a little while to find this place on our live maps but it was totally worth it. The place was very busy for lunch but still quick to seat us and quick to get our orders. It was crowded but still gave each table a sense of intimacy so you didn't feel like you were eating lunch with the people sitting next to you. The decor was very modern Scottish with wool lined booths, unfinished wooden chairs, and modern wooden art. Our server was helpful with the menu and questions we had regarding the days specials. The food was delicious. It was the first restaurant we visited in this city that seasoned each dish perfectly! I had the open faced venison sandwich. The meat was perfectly cooked and seasoned and the bread was chewy and crusty despite multiple sauces on and around it. The salad with my entree actually had a seasoned dressing drizzled on it (another first for this city which had a habit of service a side of greens with nothing else). If we ever make it back to this city, this restaurant will be one we frequent.

photos.caption: Photo of The Outsider - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Skirt steak ciabatta either baby greens, garlic mayo and chili jam
Photo of The Outsider - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Chargrilled venison, stout rarebit, wild leeks, plums, burnt onion, sherry chutney

2vvJTvUjgzF178mFp2ePDw.text: Had been wanting to try The Outsider for awhile (saw they could do gluten free) and after soaking up some culture after day 2 at the museum, I had the chance. The blackboard specials looked promising and the prices did too with many dishes priced between 6.80 and 8.00 at lunchtime.  I had hoped to get a table with a view over to the castle as I had my mum visiting but we had a table at the front which turned out to be fab! The window seats are uber comfortable with masses of pillows.  I had the mussels in a cream sauce with parmesan, bacon and onion and for a nice change they came with chips instead of bread. My mum (it was girly Jubilee weekend) had the pork belly in a red wine gravy with sweet potatoes and she said it was fabulous (I didn't try as I'm Gluten Free and wasn't sure it was safe).  Both were huge portions and we both loved our dishes. There were tons of mussels (only a couple closed) and the pail of chips seemed endless but fab with just the right amount of crispiness and some garlicky salt seasoning.  The Outsider was very busy - staff were friendly and seemed to cope. I would definitely return for dinner as the food is fab and drinks are reasonable (4 a glass if wine, 2.50 for coke) but this is a great place for a post museum lunch!

photos.caption: Photo of The Outsider - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Lunchtime portion (huge) of mussels and chips at The Outsider

_xM_SN3cRX8z64-hBDlOdA.text: One very late dinner ago, we stumbled upon this locale.   My anxiety of not having a proper dine that night, soon enough fluttered away.   The menu while not an extensive one, touched upon a good range of dishes. We wined and dined on steak & lobsters that night, with a birds eye view of the castle's luminance.  There were just two other tables that Friday night for dinner at 11.  Perfectly intimate.   That was our first night out in Edinburgh, a day after moving here.  I remembered my lobster was just right, the steak was beautifully under, the wine mingled with every sensory jive.  But not the name.    A night out for drinks and a spontaneous call for dinner this past Saturday, had us landing at a place called The Outsider.  Good ratings, food pics-check, okay we'll give it a go.  Soon as we arrived at the entrance, I was ecstatic when I realised where we were.  Dinner at 9:30 meant the place was bustling and we had to wait a good deal for our food to arrive.  But service was efficient and friendly.  Baked sea bream spiced with greens & truffle oil was delicate yet distinctly robust in flavour.  The ribeye was just gone too fast, the wine was good enough for another round, and still the same beautiful view remained.  2/2 was a hit.  I would happily return for a lovely dinner in candlelit ambiance.  Given the view, quality of food, wine list, service, I give it a solid 4 stars.

Kq94FLXs-rexrjVFB63q3A.text: I have to echo the sentiments of other reviewers; The Outsider is marvellous.  We didn't plan to go for a fancy lunch, rather just something casual and quick. But The Outsider looked too good to resist with its super cool, artsy interior and packed out restaurant. It also has such a reasonably priced lunch menu. We were welcomed warmly by the manager, which seems to be procedure as, whilst there were other waiters free, the manager made it his point to come and greet us. - A nice touch! Service was great from start to finish.  I had the venison with garlicky fries which made for such a satisfying combination. Those garlicky fries are a dream, they really are; so full of flavour and a mighty generous portion. The quality of meat was high and the venison dressing was a tangy, delicious one. The meat came on a thick crispy baguette and also with a side salad. - This was a really impressive and cheap lunch that had me excited to see just what else The Outsider has up its sleeve!  I think that my next visit will be for a special occasion and I've no doubts that they'll impress.

ZZOhStd4Wtj9zIqr9sQ2hA.text: One of the best places I enjoyed while in Edinburgh. It wasn't a bad walk from my hotel and the atmosphere was rather enjoyable. It was a cozy dining situation but not too loud. There was three in my party and we didn't make a reservation. One in my party ordered the venison which was well prepared. I enjoyed the Hake which was spot on in preparation, great flavor as well. I found the portion size a little light in the size of protein. Over all I will end up coming back when I visit in the future.

pmWk8SnMEKkPBQsx-wF6Ug.text: Perfect place for lunch (significantly cheaper than dinner). Casual but great ambiance. I got the special, the lamb with potatoes, which was delicious and flavorful. Everything is well presented and the service is great.

0VIAMnWu3QGdkIUIdeWGzg.text: This is a late review and I want to remember to compliment the restaurant.   Last winter, we were walking back from a day of tourism and we wanted to eat meat our hotel. First look it's dim (can't read the menu in candle light) but the menu looks interesting. We booked a slot and came back. An hour into the meal, the restaurant is full. Mostly locals. Good sign. We ordered the appetizer which came with a skewer of sorts and salad. I ordered a seafood stew (yum) and my partner ordered the fish. All good. We came back the next evening to try the other specials. Service was attentive and waiter have good recommendations for dessert. Seating is tight and can get noisy if you want a private conversation. In colder nights they will insist that they take your coats although some diners have theirs hung on their chairs. It's not strictly enforced. With the flickering candle lights on the table, checking your coats is a precaution.  Get a seat by the window for the view of the castle. It's very relaxing if you come in early to enjoy the twilight over a vino.

S2mI2vk5zIn8XLCyvEbOyg.text: Wining and Dining Castle view cannot be missed A date Anyone?

O-elMZnnfmujMJ4i3w4HhQ.text: Learned of this restaurant on Yelp.  Was eager to try getting a reservation with a view of Edinburgh Castle.  We were able to see the castle from our table, a real treat.  The food was great.  I had the rib eye steak; it was among the most tender and flavorful I've ever eaten.

-W5_NY1AG21LeWyegawXQQ.text: Excellent food and drink with a great view. Can you ask for any more?   The starters we had were great, as we're the desserts. My only wish was that the side salad had just a bit more of a dressing/flavor on it... but overall everything was fresh and really tasty, and well prepared.   My favorite was the goat cheese crustini with a mint sauce, simply beautiful and lovely.

CNIaN6LQRzj5T24Th-6Mrw.text: What a pleasant farm to table experience in the heart of Edinburgh (just on the Royal Mile) - if the blackboard up front with the specials doesn't set you off then at least the menu and thoughtfully picked out wine list should point you to the fact that this is a sustainable food joint and people behind the helm care as much about what the food tastes like as how it came - had a local fish dish that was in the specials paired with seasonal vegetables. Would recommend this place for a nice lunch or dinner

photos.caption: Photo of The Outsider - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Fish special with Bok choy, hake dumpling and sherry vinagatette

WwfBA_R1M4PRAUhOAGhItg.text: My wife and I's favorite restaurant of the week. The atmosphere was simple, elegant with rustic touches. The service very good and the food topped it off, wonderful presentation, portions and fresh. Highly recommend and won't break the bank.

photos.caption: Photo of The Outsider - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Sexy and cool wine descriptions.
Photo of The Outsider - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

l9Pj0ywR3cmvEBlw78zZcw.text: I asked my server if I was on a reality show about pop up restaurants. I randomly walked into this gem and I've never been so happy with everything. Food is excellent, service is perfect and cost is very affordable for the combination of the above two qualities. Two things I've never done in my life. 1. Written a yelp review while still in the restaurant 2. Booked dinner here as well (just finished lunch).  Oh yeah I forgot... your view is only if the castle and the skyline of this beautiful city.

2drOiPyzAXeabsfXv-dntQ.text: Ok, once you find The Outsider you will be pleased! Family of 5 with there teenage children and everyone was happy. Muscles in a cream sauce were probably the best we've ever had (and we live in the Pacific Northwest of the US), steak was tender and perfectly cooked, venison was wow also! Good wine selection with reasonable prices. This is don't miss in Edinburgh.

photos.caption: Photo of The Outsider - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

8AJiWrWzz0i1CLvK4CvxPQ.text: Ate here the day we arrived in Edinburgh and it was a very good meal. Not the best food I've ever had but still good. The best part was their crusty artisan bread that came with herb oil for dipping.  Otherwise my friend had the bass with sea spaghetti and I had the pigeon breast.  The atmosphere of this place is the best part. We sat in a cozy couch corner booth and they had melt candles at every table. Wait staff was very attentive.  Great meal.

photos.caption: Photo of The Outsider - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Pigeon breast with veggies! Yum!

TrB8z8CNuweB6tR6Nyiglw.text: I was hoping this would be a great place bc of the good reviews but I didn't have a great experiences. There are two waiters,  the younger one is great (would give one more star bc of him) but the other presents as snobbish and treated me as if better than me. I did cone in after a long day out,  in hiking boots and with my backbag but edinburgh is supposed to be a causal place... he glanced at me funny,  then later was quite impatient and not helpful in selecting my main course.  The younger waiter helped me think starter and dessert through.  The older waiter was snooty with me when asking about the pinot noir..."Of course it's good! " Then, the hot dishes were rather cold... not cool! Dessert is fine. Also,  none of the waiters came by once to ask how the food is our if I need anything... sorry but I expect more from an expensive restaurant!

25j99q8JqSMhHjkZR1uTkQ.text: Dined here because recommend in Rick Steve's book.  We ordered ribeye and fish.  Steak was good and fish was very good.  Service was good and friendly.  Prices were reasonable.  I would go back.

4-d6DBRJfw3P_kHvquH9wQ.text: The Outsider is a place that you plan to go to, not simply walk by and stop in. And this is for good reason. The food is excellent. This was the second lunch here for my wife and me. Our first time we had just walked in, and had to wait a bit for a table. This time we took the wisdom to phone ahead for a reservation.   As you'll read in many of the reviews, The Outsider is a modern restaurant with chic interior and great views of the castle and the Old Town. This contrast in decor and the historical surroundings gives you a feeling almost as if you have travelled from a medieval city into a cosmopolitan restaurant of the future. However, while many of the 'restaurants' within a stone's throw of the castle serve up steak pie, balmoral chicken and fish and chips (all of which I love at the appropriate time), The Outsider focuses more on a Renaissance of the taste buds rather than traditional Scottish fare.   The wife and I have been highly attracted to the lunch menu prices. A meal and a drink for two would only just push you over the 20 mark. In fact, without drinks, you can eat for just under 15, even with a starter. And when you compare that to other restaurants considered to be more affordable at lunch time, then I think I'll pay a 1 or 2 quid more and have a much better meal.   Each time we have been here the restaurant has 3 specials served 12-7pm added onto the regular lunch menu served 12-5pm. My philosophy is that if one of the specials appears rather appealing, then I'll have that and try a regular menu choice later. I did that again this time and  the duck special with Parmesan mash potatoes, purple broccoli and black pudding, drizzled in a very tasty sort of creamy raspberry sauce. It was really good. If I was a better writer I would describe it in bigger words ;)   While I would say that the food and decor were excellent, I was slightly less impressed with the service, and I do mean ever so slightly. The staff are very friendly, don't get me wrong. The two times I have been here we have had servers who spoke fluent english, but, however, they had problems explaining what things were on the menu. In fact our most recent server had to go ask what some of the items were on the regular menu. I feel like any staff at a restaurant should be able to describe and explain exactly what a dish is and what is in it.   If you're planning an afternoon in Edinburgh, then you should definitely stop here for lunch, especially instead of any of the other well spoken of restaurants even on the same street.

photos.caption: Photo of The Outsider - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

3NFC8rtz8MSccQGaH55XDg.text: The Outsider was the one restaurant that stood out from my two days in Edinburgh - and not in a good way. The food was expensive, but it wasn't even that good. The one thing that I really liked about this restaurant was the extremely comfortable booth. I think I could fall asleep amongst those pillows. Also kudos for using actual stick candles. As for the food, the portions were big, but the combination of flavors were confusing and all over the place.   For starters, we had the slow roasted pork belly, dauphinoise potatoes, buttered greens, and shallot gravy. It was better than my main course, which was a pan roasted cod fillet with salmon, chilli and coriander potato cake and a mussel salsa. The cake was very grainy and the cod was completely dried out and lacked acidity. It was one of the few times when I left food on the plate. One highlight from dinner was the olive oil that accompanied the bread.   I haven't tried much modern European cuisine, but if The Outsider was a good example, I don't think I am a fan.

photos.caption: Photo of The Outsider - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of The Outsider - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Goat cheese and pumpkin pithivier with roasted beetroot, almonds, and sun blushed tomato salad
Photo of The Outsider - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Pan roasted cod fillet with salmon, chilli and coriander potato cake and a mussel salsa

Gy0x9SnH_GAq6AhKLxS6bA.text: This is a definite treat restaurant for me. Bigger prices, smaller portions, but I find that when food is this good you don't need as much to fill you up - every mouthful counts double.  It's stylish inside - chic yet welcoming, with a very cosy looking alcove for super-intimate celebrations. My friend and I came here on a special occasion and were delighted to be seated next to the window, looking directly across the rooftops of Edinburgh and onto the castle. The views only got more gorgeous as the sun went down.  Last time I was here a while ago, I ordered the gnocchi, then told my waiter I might go with the risotto instead. He confided that he thought I'd be better off sticking with the gnocchi, in his opinion. (I love it when wait-staff are happy to advise on the food!) Well, this time I bravely sallied forth and had the risotto, for comparison. The gnocchi had been delicious, but the red pepper and walnut risotto was actually more to my taste! Perhaps it was a little more punchy and obvious in the flavour, but that's right up my street, and the texture was perfect.  Our desserts had just arrived - plum tarte tatin with vanilla creme anglaise and ginger ice cream for my friend, vanilla and raspberry pannacotta with pistachio biscotti for me - when I blinked and everything got darker. Oh no! A power cut!  Actually, it was sort of lovely to have a candlelit dinner and the restaurant looked stunning in the low light. However, we'd been there since six o'clock. The poor people who had only arrived for 7 or 7:30 were shortly to be informed that no more food could be served.  The waiting staff immediately set about the task. Our waitress had been a cheery delight right from the off - we'd commented to each other on it right away - and now was exactly the same as she went around each of her tables in turn, explaining the situation apologetically and totting up bills with her iPhone. Almost everybody responded with equal warmth and moved on perfectly happily. I do hope nobody was unkind to the staff since it wasn't their fault at all.  She came to us last, which we were perfectly fine with, since we'd been fortunate enough to actually have our full meal (at one point I heard her say to a table she'd just dealt with, "Now then, where shall I go next? Who looks angriest?"). To our amazement, despite what must have been a nightmare evening for her, she'd also remembered everything we'd had. She even knocked our teas off the bill as an apology for the circumstances - which was lovely, although not necessary. My friend summed it up as we left: "I don't think I've had such a fun night in ages!"  So if you go to The Outsider, obviously you can't expect a power cut. But you can expect obscenely good food, a beautiful setting, and superhero service from start to finish regardless of the situation.

photos.caption: Photo of The Outsider - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. The VIEW, you guys.
Photo of The Outsider - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Yummy crusty bread with basil oil and butter

6Y3zOOvMm_ByMWUaJntTNw.text: Fabulous views and great food. I was so glad that we had made a reservation. It is easy to see why one would need one. They fill up quick and for good reason! If you're on a mussel tour (like myself) you'll be pleasantly surprised with theirs! Delicious! It can be a bit crowded and loud, but still worth it!

VJygKKGS2XHLE10X7YJs5Q.text: We loved it so much we had lunch here twice in our 3-day stay!  Try the Rosemary gnocchi, it's awesome. Their specials are delicious too. They also have great big windows with a view of the castle.  Very good service and overall experience.

Jfm-yMzHB0S9Gk1Nwu9v0w.text: Damn this place has it GOIN ON for lunch! I've been backpacking around Europe for the better part of a month and this is easily the best meal I've had. Definitely a big emphasis on fresh modern fare which I enjoyed, and the price point for lunch is spot on. Spent like 12 for an entree (chicken, hella bomb), bread (pretty good frickin bread I might add), and wine which is INSANE for the UK. I spent the same amount for a pint and some s***** fish and chips down the road. A must visit if you're comin thru Eburgh. Absolutely going there again for lunch tomorrow

kS2vJyfT6LUtiog_6ZLSHQ.text: Beautiful restaurant and delicious food. I had the venison and rabbit lunch special. Absolutely scrumptious

q-Kp2pT5y350R6mjaMpv-A.text: Came here because of the other yelp reviews. I was not disappointed. I'm closer to a carnivore than most, but I still found the very healthy, and green, CHL thai chicken amazing. The stuffed pita that came with, while a little intimidating in appearance, was quite sweet and made a very nice addition to the meal.

DGh1kfbsuoXHYri0e2esag.text: The Outsider is a really great restaurant located on George IV Bridge.  It would have to go on my list of favourite places to eat in Edinburgh.  Although I've only eaten here once, I'd definitely go back when finance allows.  The outside of this establishment says cool and stylish.  The inside matches this, and does not disappoint.  This was the first ever place where I was given some bread and that oil/balsamic vinegar mixture to dip it in.  I was slightly confused to have been given something that I had not ordered, but I was glad to discover that it was complimentary.  I had the steak as a main course, which was brought out very swiftly, and was very tasty.  The restaurant was quite busy when I was there, and so it's perhaps not the place to go if you're looking for a quiet romantic meal.  That said, I did not feel lost in a sea of other customers, and was efficiently taken care of throughout the course of my meal.  The Outsider provided me with a meal that I still remember, and that shows how much I enjoyed it.  This is not a regular occurrence for a restaurant.  I have recommended it to a number of friends, and I look forward to my next visit!

photos.caption: Photo of The Outsider - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

HXQEJeuVllbl61Rvnrs_Ew.text: Amazing food!!!!!  The only reason we didn't give 5 stars is because the wine list wasn't great.  If you're going to have good food, you must have good wine!

XPd8KHK9tE7rbyWVX1qbXA.text: I've walked past this place loads of times, and yet never felt the urge to wander in and try it. It always just looks a bit too "style over substance", as if there's not much to it aside from a slightly pretentious-sounding menu.  Today, however, I was proven wrong. I went for lunch with some friends after finishing our exams, and I was really impressed. The food was gorgeous, and surprisingly good value for money. I had a smoked trout salad on a bed of mixed leaves, with a mango and yoghurt dressing, whilst my friends had the home-made chilli burger with garlic fries. It was all really well-made, and really nicely presented too.  That said, the waitress did do the one thing that is a pet hate of mine in restaurants - she started clearing the plates away before half of us had even finished. I'm the first to admit that I'm a bit obsessive about manners when it comes to food, but it still got on my nerves.  Apart from that though, I was pleasantly surprised and I will definitely be going back.

photos.caption: Photo of The Outsider - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

ODpC0QY2pdaGRUylP5KaSA.text: Before I actually came here,  I was told it's one of those arty new restaurants, with minimalist decoration, and apparently the owner didn't approve of people hanging their coats on the back of the chairs and they were quickly taken to the cloak cupboards.   So walking in I was expecting a "too-cool-for-you attitude" How wrong I was.  The menu is interesting (for a change), and it gets a revamp seasonally. I had the pigeon dish (can't remember what it's actually called but chose it mostly because it had a warning about containing gunshot) and on a different occasion had a kebab dish- both delicious! They have platters to share as well. The cheese selection is decent and their homemade bread is too moreish.  The interior is mostly dark. However, this doesn't make it a dark place, instead, the glorious view from the enormous windows of the lit-up Castle outside.  The service is layed back and chilled but efficient and professional at the same time. On both occasions I had dinner there with my family our waitress (a different girl each time) was lovely and very friendly. And they didn't take our coats (they offered but it was not compulsory). Only thing I can hold against it is the noise level gets really bad because the ceilings are so high- at times it gets hard to talk at a normal volume.Also, it is a bit pricey but the portions are huge,the quality is great and they have a great lunch deal. It's cheaper (about 6-10 pounds for a main at lunch and about 9-15 pounds for a dinner if you skip out on drinks/starters/dessert so not too bad for a proper restaurant) .  To sum up I absolutely love this slightly different restaurant and it's ideal for a special occasion or to just treat yourself and your friends/date.

photos.caption: Photo of The Outsider - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

jQPz5P-C8tDC2RnEFDLh7A.text: Came here for lunch twice in 2 days and would come tomorrow if I didn't have to go home to London. Excellent service coupled with high quality and varied dishes, wine and dessert. Ideal for a lunch date, first date or taking your granny out for a treat.

VihES_DxzzYWnJplHT80Jw.text: Oh my goodness, the view. We lucked out and got a table by the window thanks to our innkeeper. The view of the castle at night was incredible. Reasonable prices. Hysterically funny wine descriptions. We 3 started with olives and a cheese board. The oatcakes were very nice. Then a portobello mushroom toast for my dinner. Son got a steak with outstanding garlicky fries. Hubby got chicken kebab. The slaw with it wasn't a favorite. Service was excellent. 100 for 3 with 2 bottles of wine.

cCDyEI4TKnQrZAvcY4jQhg.text: I do not have a bad word to say about this lovely restaurant. I went there last night for my birthday dinner with my fiance and my dad and it was fantastic. The staff were friendly and efficient. The starters, mains and dessert were all delicious. I particularly enjoyed the polenta and rosemary biscuit that came with the poached pear and chocolate pot. The guinea fowl was lovely and tender and the chorizo and squid salad had a nice flavour. There was no loud obnoxious music and although the tables were quite close together, the high ceilings made it feel spacious and not claustrophobic. Good value for money. Would definitely go again.

ZgpMtbRjZ6QhYurMTj8zdQ.text: Tempted by the ever-changing menu specials, I finally came here on Valentine's day to satisfy my curiosity.  The atmosphere here is lovely, and the service doesn't lack. They have a nice, reasonably-priced wine list too.  I was put off by having to pay for an order of bread -- that's unheard of to an American -- but when it came I forgot about the piddling 1.30 or however much it was, because the bread was amazing. As was the olive oil they served with it. Really, really nice stuff.  Both of the mains my husband and I ordered were really delicious -- duck for me, pheasant for him -- but I would have liked a bit more mash and greens to round out the meal. I felt a bit hungry as we left. I don't think I'm greedy, I just eat a lot! We probably should have ordered appetizers but I didn't think we would need to, and I didn't want to drop 5 on an unimpressive dessert menu.  Overall -- a great place to take a date, with creative and tasty food.

31OT7UbZS8IQkFIcCAlHMA.text: We stopped in for lunch. My son and husband had the burger and I had the mussels. YUM!! Both were fantastic, the ambiance was warm and welcoming. We got there right at 12:00 when they opened. By 12:30 it was packed. Approximately 6.50 per lunch meal, extraordinary deal for quantity and taste.

NBZGEiSzn5GEHMaIZbfrpg.text: Thanks to Jenny L. I took my parents here when they were in town for a couple of days and, man, this is impressive.  I begged the manager for a window-seat, claiming everything from far-sightedness, to parents-in-town, and managed to get it!  Let me tell you, sitting at the window at night overlooking the castle is a pretty damn cool way to convince your parents that you've picked the right city to live in.   Now, about the food: I had the salmon-beetroot salad and fries, and man, was it delicious. I don't know how they did it, but they'd infused the salmon with beetroots somehow, I forgot to ask, but it was the most delicious salmon salad I've ever had in my life. And that's saying a lot, since I used to live in Santa Monica, and Seattle (both having easy access to vast quantities of this delicous fishy). They combined it with watermelon, spinach, and various greens and it was just to-die-for. I know that both my parents enjoyed their meals so much that their plates were absolutely cleaned out.   Not only are these rather reasonable prices (mains from 11.00-19.00 pounds) the quality that you get for this price is absolutely insane. I'd definitely recommend this for a visit and I'm coming back again soon!

4tjwcCmFE8r8Wcp2DuX94g.text: What a lovely restaurant in the city center.  Very simple setting and decor.  The tables by the window looked lovely and though my date asked for that, we didn't get it. The food was simple and delicious.  I had the coley with potatoes, which I've never had before and it's a tasty white fish. The portion wasn't too big and my date had the poussin and it was a very large portion, very tasty as well. First time I've ever had these dishes and I liked them both.  For dessert we had a chocolate tarte which was so rich, but delicious.  Service was good and I had a great date at this place.

BYjsNauGsShfblpLLVtM8g.text: We couldn't see the view because we were placed on the street side.  So apparently you need to request a view when you make reservations, or be prepared to wait a bit.  The food was quite good--we both ordered the skirt steak.  The problem was that we ordered medium rare, and one was bright purple, while the other was slightly more cooked.  We decided they should be sent back to be heated a bit.  They basically threw both back in for the same amount of time, and they came back half the size and one was medium and the other was medium-well.  I'm typically not very picky and I don't think I've sent any food back in about 15 years.  I ate the overcooked meat and my girlfriend shared her slightly-less-cooked piece with me.    It was very tasty, and I assume the cooking issue was a one-off mistake rather than a reflection on the restaurant.  But I certainly can't give this place too high of a reco.  I did like the service a lot, and felt good when the waiter confirmed that our steaks did indeed look undercooked by stating "that's not rare...that's blue!"  Our appetizers were good and the bread was tasty I think.

rO6R2-I6VAaM_k4DYPTP3g.text: Friendly service, creative menu and delicious dessert. Really happy we stopped in for dinner and would highly recommend anyone checking it out who enjoys unique food and a great ambiance.

InlG1Z82TvOlA8XBadjNiA.text: This restaurant was recommended by our hotel. It was our first night in Edinburgh and we were looking for a fun restaurant. We didn't have reservation but we were seated right away. The restaurant's ambience is very nice and lively. We were seated near the front door but I noticed that the better view is all the way in the back where you have a better view.  I noticed that the servers were all very busy and always in a hurry. I should have picked up on it that service will be very slow. And it was. It took awhile for our food to come out. We were going to order dessert and asked our waitress to bring us the menu. We waited and waited and didn't get the menu. So we just decided to ask for our bill so we can pay and get out of there.  The food was not good. My boyfriend ordered the skirt steak and I had the pork belly with scallops. There was hardly any flavor in both. The quality of the meat used in the skirt steak was poor. We found much better restaurants in the area.

NDWzKuwwf9hjNEgahi3wsg.text: Lovely restaurant. Been here a fair few times over the past few years and it's always been great.  Getting a table with a view of the castle is well worth it if you can.  The staff are really nice and very accommodating.  I remember the first time I went they had homemade gnocchi with cavolo nero, which was just perfection (as great as all the other dishes have been, they've not quite hit the mark as that one did...)

QJBivR8ahiELAWQop_6XFw.text: I'm sorry, but this place was not as good as it seems some people say it is. Good points are, food was good and there is quite a good view of Edinburgh Castle if you are seated near the back of the restaurant. That's it, I'm afraid, for the good points.  First of all, if you're looking for the place on a recommendation, you might find it difficult to spot. The front of the place is pretty much lacking in any noticeable signage. If you look closely, and I did, but still had to have the name pointed out to me: there are two columns of wooden tiles between the windows, and on them are dark letters spelling out the word OUTSIDER. Other than that, you'd be excused for thinking that the place was going through a renovation or something.   Inside is very light and roomy and the tables seem to be randomly placed between all the wall tables and booths. The manager that meets you at the door seems to have his head somewhere in the profit books as he shows you to a table, you know, just not quite giving you all his attention. He also looked like he'd slept in, with his hair dishevelled and chin unshaven. The grandpa shirt tops of the look of art student in fourth year at art school.  Once seated you are handed a photocopy of a menu. Not a bad idea if you update your menu everyday, but, some ink in the photocopier would be a good idea too. I have good eyesight, but half the menu was totally illegible to me. Most of the menu was in a small type but there was something handwritten at the top. This was totally unreadable.  I managed to find something that sounded nice so I ordered it and it was very well cooked and tasty.  It wasn't a huge portion but it was charged as a full meal.  I have given two stars, one for the food and one for the castle view.

aSvjuxtYd8C7198c5ewD6Q.text: Had an awesome lunch for 3 on holiday in the UK at the end of March 2013.  Great garlic fries.  Wonderful mussels (plentiful and a nice broth).  Had a great pork loin dish that really hit the spot, my wife's pasta was superb.  Fresh ingredients, efficient service at the busiest time of the lunch rush, nice, hip, bustly and pleasant atmosphere.  Very reasonable prices at lunch, too.

RlxtleriLtyP7mzoKOV5WA.text: It's hard finding tasty and good value for money in Edinburgh when it comes to the food scene cause there's so many great restaurants in this city, but I have to admit this is one of them. In what ever city I live in, I always have at least one go to restaurant that I know won't fail me...in terms of flavour, cost, service, ambience, and most importantly filling me up.   This trendy restaurant with one of the best views of Edinburgh castle fit that bill and have yet to disappoint me (hopefully it will never, fingers cross). I tried the majority of their main meat dishes in my past visit so I decided to explore their fish mains. I've always wanted to try their fish stew which was filled with hake, clams, mussels, shrimp, and salmon. On a cold windy night, this dish certainly was the perfect choice so I selected it as my main. I skipped the first course cause I wanted to save room for dessert.   The dish came out on a wooden cutting board with salad and bread on the side. This bowl of fish stew was massive! The smell of the broth had remnants of the sea and the vision of the dish in a darkly lit room by the candlelight deserved an applause. The stew was piping hot and the flavours was a well blended symphony of the fish and shellfish. There was a healthy serving of fish (hake and salmon) as well as the clams. Two slight negatives about this dish though:   #1. It only had 1 shrimp  #2. While the flavour of the broth was amazing, I thought it needed a dash of salt to really round out the flavour of the dish. If it wasn't for those two things, I would say this was a home run kind of dish! Almost forgot to mention, but this dish was around 16!   For the dessert, I ordered chocolate and espresso pave with molasses ice cream. This was pure orgasm in my mouth. The ganache made from the chocolate and espresso was a perfect match and the espresso elevated the flavour of the chocolate. The ice cream complimented the richness and slight bitterness of the chocolate and espresso pave while the crunchy bits and shavings of chocolate  introduced texture. Absolutely perfect dessert if you're a chocoholic and definitely worth the 5.40!   The servers were great and attentive. They knew the dishes since I asked what some were and they came by our table just at the right moments to make sure we were doing ok. These servers motivate me to give them tip, no need to ask me twice!   The ambience in this place is awesome. I like the trendiness of the decor, the big windows, and candlelit tables.   The one thing I like about this place is I can depend on it and I know it'll deliver, just like a good friend. The only thing I would want them to do is change their menu maybe at least every 6 months, because while what they are making is great... I'm sure they would be an even more of an amazing restaurant if they took risks and introduced new dishes on a regular basis.

JQkMqks9kaMdL3ESd4rU_w.text: Loved this hidden gem for lunch. Amazingly good food in a touristy part of town that has a lot of mediocre food. Wonderful menu that changes daily and the dishes we ordered were yummy and well worth the price.

HQrjQYIA7tQl0dV5LY5vvA.text: A very busy place. Reservations a must on a Friday or Saturday evening.  Dinner was OK.   Arbroath smokie crumble. Good smoky fish in a cheesy sauce but the crumble was more large chunks of toasted oats. The roasted lamb rump was good, but served on a couple of lumps of something that we couldn't quite figure out, and had to send back.  Great potential.

KN70RGi1ZxVLLIZM4DH6hg.text: Lovely service, delicious food, stunning view!! Just been for the first time but will definitely go again!

IgEJDtb0XCqIB_OAC9XrDg.text: Very fresh&tasty mussels. From the restaurant you can see the castle through the windows. So if you are lucky enough to get a window seat, this could be the best art of your Edinburgh experience.

agKYGVdkGJYo6AyRGeQxaQ.text: Went here for lunch. If you go, I would highly recommend asking for a seat facing Edinburgh Castle. There is an upstairs too that would be great. The atmosphere is excellent for a great lunch.  We went and the service was a little disjointed. The restaurant was not too crowded and we were sat and drinks and even food ordered with a girl we thought was our waitress. Then we needed drinks refreshed and our girl was there, but didn't come back over. The table next to us had another waitress so we politely asked her for some more water. She got us water. That girl and a man I assume was the manager brought us our food. The dishes are very beautifully plated. I ordered venison with rarebit. I thought it was under all the veggies, but upon my first bite, I noted there was no venison, but instead there was fish. I then tried to get everyone's attention including the three different people who had been to my table. It was not until I walked up to the manager at the bar that I got my attention due to my dish being wrong. The second girl then got my correct dish. They apologized, but then continued to ignore us after. I was not impressed with that.  That said, my venison and rarebit was decent. Price point was good. I think this was just a case of me finding a place on good reviews and hoping everyone was correct. :-/

tOFLvb4YaaShInVpki9LQw.text: This place was so good, we already want to go back. The restaurant itself has a great vibe and wonderful views. The lunch prices are so reasonable and the quality of food superb. I enjoyed the seared venison salad. The meat was seasoned and prepared perfectly rare. It was served on a bed of greens with roast potato, apples and beets. They left off the blood pudding as it contains gluten.   The wine list is described in a way that makes you want to order a glass of each. Non-alcoholic fresh presses and cordials are also available. We didn't have room to indulge in dessert, but the selection sounded amazing.

bxRNv8fVHfmWUKh6sOoStA.text: Good fresh and ok. Tables closed together, can be noisy when busy. Dinner mains 18-24, side 4. Lunch menu looks better value. Service & food can be slow when busy.

i-Alcr4AbNFj3jWaImM3bg.text: Don't let the exterior fool you, this is a lovely restaurant with an upbeat vibe and good service.   Upon being seated, we were given a list of 4 dishes that were unavailable as they'd run out, and also told they'd run out of bread, which seemed odd.   Nonetheless, once we made our selections, both meals were well presented, of a good size, and most importantly, fresh & delicious!   Good wine selection (though again, our waiter brought our bottle out with a light-hearted comment about not enjoying it too much, as it was the last one of that sort in stock), and while we passed on dessert, being too full to eat it, the options available looked great.

EMJzt1-mCWzIC3LxcokquQ.text: Friendly service, nice contemporary ambiance, and delicious foods. The host greeted us and although we did not have reservations as we just got back from a long day of site seeing, he said he would check to see if he could get us a table.  After a short wait, he got us a nice table.  The rat if the meal and evening was absolutely enjoyable.

xD0idpuWhptdr5Iqu0WmpA.text: The Outsider has a really cool, laid back atmosphere that verges on quirky ... in a good way.   Great service - the waitress ran through the menu, water was brought automatically to the table and they were flexible when ordering vegan versions of menu offerings and swapping out elements of a main with a side.  The food was delicious (I had the rabbit and tarragon pie from the lunch menu) and almost unbelievably well priced.  A great place for lunch or dinner.

ihemLpj4Df44qH3ZXWFXdQ.text: Adorable Restaurant just off the Royal mile.  Wonderful warm and inviting gem of a spot with nice wine list, candle lit tables, tasty food and lovely view of the back side of the castle!  We will be back!

uKVn5Ma0KEWLPy4bIjBxtA.text: This was the surprise of the trip. Candlelit dinner with a night view of Edinburgh Castle as we tried to find a place for our last night. I was blown away by this meal here in Edinburgh. I ended up eating their roast venison per the waiter's suggestion and this dish was paired alongside red braised cabbage, parsnips, thinly sliced and crisped ham on top a heavenly broccoli puree. The roast venison cooked medium rare was red, meaty and so tender and honestly one of the best meals I've had while in Europe. Friends of mine ate the mussels in the wine sauce and got hefty helpings that had them slurping and dipping bread over glasses of wine. Great night and atmosphere

photos.caption: Photo of The Outsider - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Roast Venison with red braised cabbage, parsnips, thinly sliced pieces of ham over a broccoli purée

X_eVZxPbSa9anqDIEbfQaQ.text: My husband had the salmon chunky health line and he said that it was delicious and very large. I had the fish filet with saffron cream and potatoes and the portion was much smaller, but it was also very good. For dessert, he had the chocolate pot and I had the plum tart with ginger ice cream. Excellent!  This is a nice place for a leisurely dinner, but it would be nicer if it was a bit quieter. We were a party of four middle-aged people and we kept asking each other "what?"

photos.caption: Photo of The Outsider - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Fish filet with scallops, saffron cream, and potatoes

v-aHPnRucQos9mBc0Y4TTQ.text: I searched Yelp for dinner spots and I am very happy to report that The Outsider lived up to the rave reviews. I loved the decor, the food, the drinks, everything. Their wine selection is pretty good but their beers are limited to bottles. We were happy to see blue moon on the menu though. I tried the lamb and my boyfriend had the ribeye and both were mouth wateringly good. Loved it! I'd have to say we almost didn't get a table as we were given the only 2 seater left, I'd suggest making a reservation if you can. Definitely go here when you are in Edinburgh!!! You will not be disappointed!

photos.caption: Photo of The Outsider - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. The lamb, so good!!!

sTiuJzxkU6dg90TGjl6yYA.text: We went to this restaurant with my family (3 of us) because it was listed on the 10 things to do in Edinburgh. We ordered a bottle of rose, appetizers (salads, dill potatoes, sweet potatoes, bread), main dishes (lamb dish with haggis, fried gnocchi (with walnuts, arugula, a little bit of pesto), Tagliatelle pasta (with pickled artichoke hearts, olives, capers, arugula, sun dried tomatoes, goat cheese), and for dessert we shared a baked pear with a scoop of ice cream, and truffles.  I enjoyed the sweet potatoes and the bread with the very yummy olive oil. My husband review of the lamb dish was very meaty. My stepdaughter ordered the fried gnocchi and she said it was alright. My tagliatelle pasta was okay. It was very tart-y because of the pickled artichokes, olives, capers and sun dried tomatoes. Those ingredients did not compliment the tagliatelle pasta at all. Even though there was goat cheese in it, it wasn't enough to balance the tartness of the dish. Made me do the pucker face a lot!  Haha!  The dessert was really good. I enjoyed the baked pear with ice cream more than the truffles. The ambiance was warm - dimmed light and woodsy. I wasn't wowed with the food, so I'm not sure if I'll go back there again next time I visit Edinburgh. I can at least cross it off the 10 things to do in Edinburgh!

c2UGW3tQ3cydq4erAvMzNQ.text: I loved everything about this place -- from the thoughtful serving dishes (including the water pitcher), to the interior design, to the view from the windows. All of this helped elevate the food, which would have stood on its own anyway. And, you do not get gouged on the price!  TIP: free wifi if you ask for the password.

47eJdtRf_sahmSHlpfH8GQ.text: Fun, good food and friendly service. Nice buzzy atmosphere

GQFMFCKnhXgz1-OXLJ5S8w.text: Enjoyed our night here.  I had the mussels and very nice they were too.  Close to the largest serve I've ever had and very nicely cooked and presented (see photo).  Price was excellent too.  The service was also spot on as well.  Recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of The Outsider - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

mw-h2-y5K7j7vJVEGPzmaQ.text: Absolutely wonderful: food was great we ordered (steak, lobster, gnocchi) and all were very tasty. The views are also amazing of the castle; couldn't get much better with great food and ambiance. Look forward to hopefully coming back here again when visiting Edinburgh in the future. Defiantly a must try spot, and by far the best meal of the trip.

J8cbbYuhOacSH4qQzgBXWw.text: Service was very poor, almost felt like in a cheap cafe the way food served and items almost dropped on table ,extremely disappointed especially when an automatic tip added to bill . Will Not be visiting here again

rXIU2wK7Fa6IsFR4Q-JbiQ.text: Sometimes you hope that the good reviews that you hear from your friends are correct but on this occasion I was a bit disappointed.  I have been here twice.  The first time, it was during the Fringe Festival.  I came in at 12noon when it opened, but the service was extremely hurried and the food came out extremely quick.  It is the fringe after all.  I was given the table only for a set amount of time and the food seemed prepared well in advanced.  I was not impressed.  I decided to forget about it and just thought it might well be due to the fringe and fair enough all restaurants in Edinburgh will want to have a high turnover to make full use of the month of tourist.    Fast forward 1 year later, I decided to give it another try outside of the Fringe festival.  Less hurried service obviously.  However, the food still did not impress me at all.  Yes, it has a good location and good window seats.  But that is about it.  The food did not provide enough punch to my tastebuds.  I had the mussels and lamb for the main course.  The mussels were ordinary and the lamb was a bit overcooked and was slightly tough.  Perhaps it was not the best cut and it was not cooked pink.  I will come back for special occasion with friends but unsure if I will suggest this myself.  Not bad but not a place I would come myself.
