HfLlV5Q4lqZpjX1lBfMsjw.text: The Outsider was an outlier during my Scotland trip for a number of reasons, primarily, it's waitstaff who took advantage of our tourist status. They were disappointing in a number of ways including:  1. ADDING AUTOMATIC GRATUITY to the bill-- I'm American, and no stranger to tipping, but have not encountered this experience *anywhere* else in Scotland. Only at The Outsider 2. REFUSAL to allow patrons to taste the wine that they ordered in a bottle.  I asked and the answer I got was "no, we don't do that here." A common practice in almost every restaurant that I've been to when ordering wine by the bottle is for the wait staff to show you the vintage (to assure you that they've acquired the right wine), uncork the wine and then pour a small bit to allow you to taste the wine in case it went bad from the corkage. This is a common practice from the most mom and pop at the ends of the Earth to the double Michelin star in the most cosmopolitan of places. 3. SELF SERVICE is expected. Again, after just uncorking the bottle of wine, the waitress left the bottle and presumably, we poured our wine ourselves from the bottle. It's not that we can't do it, but we can also serve our own food, bus our own table and hunt down our own animals. But I'm paying for my food and ambiance and apparently the automatic gratuity so I have expectations of service. 3. RUDENESS. At some point, the candle at our table had melted down into a nub, and we'd ask for a replacement candle lest the table catch on fire. The waitress, just decided to come over and blow it out. LOL. Thank you, why we couldn't have done that ourselves.   4. Food itself was....unspectacular. Exactly what you'd expect from a mid-tier restaurant--nothing innovative enough to outshadow the terrible service (only reason this place go 2 stars vs 1 star).There was a feeling that the wait staff couldn't wait to get make you miserable, so that you'll eat the food faster (after they charge you a gratuity of 12%! in a country where people don't usually tip that much, and only then I heard 10%+ is reserved for amazing service!)

Gh9BD_5UvkUD-aTn8FoGnQ.text: Not easy to find, but worth it.  The food is great and the environment is cool.  Not a quiet place though.   We wanted to try The Outsider earlier this week, but had a heck of a time finding it. Today was easy and we were lucky to grab dinner, walking in at 7:30.  They take reservations and you might to do that on the weekend evening.   We had the venison, the lamb and the hake. All were very good. Nothing over- nor under-cooked. Spiced well, but mild.  We finished with deserts, including rhubarb, chocolate & espresso pane, and baked pear. The pear was really flavorful. The Pane was a big portion but really not too rich and the molasses ice cream was not strong at all. The rhubarb was very mild compared to the rhubarb we have in the US, which tends to be really tart.   With a bottle of wine, the meal, a single side salad, and 3 coffees, the total was 128.  Really great consider the great food.

9TtctwDjoJoV9tWQaecQmw.text: My husband and I came here for dinner. Loved the ambiance. People were great. Menu options had lots of variety. Food was better than good but not great. We'd both go back. Worth the experience for sure.

bsagiA-8elB5RK8a2nQjqQ.text: Amazing food , these guys know what they are doing and super service by the rest of the staff

aAstggCNFbVa4M1MiADOKQ.text: Now that I've been to Edinburgh twice and tried several of their most renowned restaurants I can confidently say this is one of the best.  I love how eclectic the venue is with the view of the castle the mezzanine 2nd floor and the big windows. I love their heavy metal water jugs and how simple the place is decorated.  But most of all, I love how simply delicious their food is. It's exactly the right balance of creative and traditional, nice variety and ever changing menu.  It's so good I wish we'd gone back one last time for lunch before we left.

o5pPUozjXJRkTRD3M8ygAA.text: This place is cool, the food was actually really good and the service people were friendly. However we had the sun blaring into our eyes the entire time and they refused to do a birthday celebration for my mom. They also kicked us off of our table before we could order desert!

fbG0AYwltJbe1JQXEK232g.text: Shame on you for fooling tourists!  The food was ok, nothing special but what left a VERY bitter taste was the fact that our waitress gave me a 5 note that was apparently not valid since may 2017 (!), something you're well aware working in the restaurant business. Me, being a stupid tourist became aware of this when refused paying with it about two hrs after our visit at the restaurant.  Once again, shame on you for fooling tourists! Stay away people!

0KUHJh5Z89Kn4sbrSImzmA.text: By far the best experience I had the pleasure to experience in Edinburgh. The server was really chill, like the sexy Spaniard that would steal your girlfriend but you'd be cool with it (and secretly wish he'd take you instead). Food is easily the freshest and limited due to season, but that's what hibernation is for. The view is amazing, you can see the castle and graveyard as you enjoy your wonderfully witty wine (whoever wrote the wine menu has a great appreciation for wine and the comedy). It's definitely a place that would make me miss Edinburgh the most, step aside castle!

zFIEhAoM3a-4EMot9SdKnQ.text: This was our first dinner in Edinburgh, and as I predicted to our waiter, I didn't have a better one over the course of the following week. And I was right. The Outsider both defied and exceeded expectations: a progressive, sleek restaurant which, on a Saturday night, welcomed families, dates, and the cool set alike.  Same-day reservations while I was still jet lagged were a cinch. They took our coats and led us to a nice table for two. The meal started with some truly delicious crusty artisan bread. I could have eaten the bread for the next hour and a half and gone home happy.   The waiter recommended a couple of outstanding appetizers (wish I could remember what they were, alas..methinks it was the goat cheese and chargrilled squid salad). Then I proceeded to devour my venison haunch, which was presented on a bed of malted barley, foraged mushrooms, wild leeks, and orange jus.  The staff was extremely friendly and engaged after I expressed enthusiasm for the cuisine and told them this was my first proper Scottish meal. They gave me travel and eating pointers and seemed genuinely happy that we enjoyed the meal. Truly, one of the most memorable meals in recent memory.

NjjoNSqiacZjkk4k9ToZjA.text: 5 stars period. The food is amazing, the ambience & the staff friendly. It's way better than Devil's Advocate which is rated higher and haven't a clue why??  Anyhow, the chicken was cooked to perfection and the skewers were amazing with harrissa sauce. The beef shin was lovely. The Venison is the best I've ever had, not a gamy aftertaste at all, instead it's all citrus flavors which calm everything down.   The lamb rump is equally as good and soft. Overall the tastes gel really well together and the chef knows what he's doing in the back.

photos.caption: Photo of The Outsider - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Venison &amp; Lamb rump, both are amazing!!!
Photo of The Outsider - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Chicken skewers &amp; beef shin yum! The skewers were better tho, highly recommended!

9y3MxLxrVUCef-b2yVv8cA.text: Funky little place typical of many places in Edinburgh Old Town...loved the skewers (chicken/prawns with mojo sauce) with the pita/slaw pocket, the garlicky fries, and the Innis & Gunn ale. To top it off, great view of castle :)

photos.caption: Photo of The Outsider - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

ehhBJDD-zZ9MMZIpLvXolA.text: What a shame!  Have been here and sister restaurant The Apartment many times over the years.  Food was always good and pleasant surroundings. But tonight - even though we were hungry and the menu looked as tempting as ever - we had to walk out a few moments after sitting down.  So what's the problem?  Well, it's the manager, or whatever the man seating people tonight was called. I fear the numerous one star reviews he seems to have personally already earned this restaurant on other websites have gone to his head. How else to explain his attitude, which was inexplicably pitched somewhere between disdain and contempt?   Edinburgh has lots of terrific restaurants where you will be made to feel welcome, so - unless you actually enjoy dining on your own self respect - avoid The Outsider and go to one of those instead.  We did, and were very glad of it.

noYU2EgyGpyWjzYiv6bgfA.text: Excellent food.  Business lunch place.  A bit more upscale, but tourists are welcomed.  Terrific crispy polenta salad with heirloom tomatoes.  Nice beet salad with warm goat cheese. Artisan bread as a side. Lovely!

photos.caption: Photo of The Outsider - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Views of the castle!

kkYak7Vg0hwYlJSQLK9bcQ.text: Soooooo good! We dropped in for lunch and it was delicious. We had the mussels in the basil cream sauce (read: bacon) and the sea bass with a couple glasses of wine. The view was amazing and the food even more so. Highly recommended!

PdQyeySY9wgXccwaiprqqw.text: If you are over 40, you might find yourself unwanted in The Outsider.  My wife and I, both in our 60s and silvery, dined at "The Outsider" on the recommendation of our adult children, who enjoyed it.  Our experience was not positive.  The host -- who took forever to acknowledge our presence at the front door -- walked up to us and grabbed two menus without saying a word.  My wife said, "two," indicating there were two of us for dinner.  He stood silently for a moment, then stated derisively, "I was expecting a sentence."  After we seated the waitress asked what we would like to drink.  Since it was unseasonably warm, I asked if they had iced tea.  "We have tea," she replied dismissively, "but we don't put ice in it."  Fair enough.  I said I would have water with dinner.  Apparently, they don't put ice in water, either.  Or refill it.  All I had to drink the entire meal was a small glass of room-temperature water.  My wife ordered a Blue Moon Ale and that's all she had.  The waitress, after taking our order, never returned to our table to ask if we needed anything (like beverages).  In fact, she never spoke to us again, although she should care of younger diners.  Another employer dropped off our entrees wordlessly, not asking if we wanted anything else (like beverages).  Basically, we were ignored and treated rudely while the young wait staff doted on younger patrons.  Bear in mind that we were always polite and courteous and did nothing to inspire the rude and neglectful service we received.  The food was okay but not remarkable.  However, the service was abysmal.  The message was clear:  if you are not young, you are not wanted at The Outsider.  Elderly patrons are, ironically, "outsiders" at The Outsider.  If you're under 40 it's probably a good option.  If you're older, stay away.  They clearly don't want your business.

d7miBFpQaIHwlbY-BRgOqw.text: We were traveling to Edinburgh castle so we decided to have a delicious meal close to the castle and the Outsider Restaurant fit the bill perfectly. The food was cooked to perfection and the service was top notch! God bless you

photos.caption: Photo of The Outsider - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

Ryphb_f53YFrc6h7EDu4rA.text: The starters were delicious, but we don't think the main courses were very good.  However, this is just our opinion, but I saw some other plates that looked delicious, for example, the rib eye (I wish I had ordered this!)

m16IZJFG-hW99U-E6uxmIw.text: Second visit as great as the first, having now sampled Lunch & Dinner.   Had a great table by the window overlooking a view of the castle - great table service, great menu choices and front of house staff are very helpful in assisting you with your menu choices.   Well priced, very ultra chic surroundings - basic but kool   Just a comment, but when they offer you bread on arrival, you are charged for it....didnt spoil a great meal though

M0Tr4cgMcFINaJrjTQhoYg.text: I have to say that this was one of the best places to eat! The staff were friendly and polite and th food fantastic! Maybe slightly pricey but worth it. I recommend the steak or fish!

RdHPA22Nz3GrO__J3hPwtA.text: I have eaten here a number of times and have always really enjoyed the food - especially the garlicky fries and the beetroot coleslaw!! The atmosphere is also lovely and views of the castle are stunning.

De7VbDFaVLV8vU6cYmw7iQ.text: Have eaten here 3 times recently with different groups of friends. Really good each time. Great staff, friendly but unobtrusive service & delicious food. Easy going ambience, would recommend it!

pyiTxKlvOlHePvbAG6HsEQ.text: I've never had a bad meal here and its my daughters favourite restaurant in Edinburgh. If you can try to get a seat with a castle view it certainly adds to the experience. As I said I've always enjoyed my visits to The Outsiders, but I must admit some of my friends have had some bad experiences with rude staff. I actually prefer the sister restaurant The Apartment.

R88ZcqRxyRabiJw4T9zo2g.text: Launched as a sister restaurant to the Apartment in Bruntsfield the Outsider has, in the last eight years, acquired its own singular identity by guaranteeing good quality food at reasonable prices whilst being attended to by attractive, friendly staff. Whilst the menu hasn't changed radically over the last few years -obviously operating on a 'if it ain't broke don't fix it' maxim'-what it lacks in imagination it more than compensates for in consistency and value.Featuring stunning views of the Castle - particularly from the Mezzanine level.- an air of familiarity hangs over the atmosphers as soon as you enter and this contributes to an extremely pleasant dining experience Always busy it is wise to pre book a table to avoid disappointment.

PscHkmXXXH0AT34fOXSTWw.text: I have been passing this restaurant frequently. It seems always busy. Finally, my friends' visit gave me an excuse to try it out. It was their last night in town, so I was happy to discover the food was really delicious, the view of the castle spectacular, and the whole experience - memorable. On the downside - the noise level was a bit high, which is my overall complaint with so many places in the UK. How one is supposed to have a meaningful conversation when it is hard to hear your own thoughts? I guess you end up shouting more, which just adds to the noise level.

pzmJORq1c2GNmMYoM_t95Q.text: Great food and quite cool. Great for group bookings and eating out with friends. The food isn't super expensive but it's not a cheapy either.

NBhz5-sIjE3IFp0hnlRwCA.text: The Outsider is one of my favourite Edinburgh restaurants and is great for a weekend lunch or a cosy, romantic dinner in the evening. It has great views of the castle and the interior is very cosy and funky. The food is gorgeous and reasonably priced, particularly the lunch menu where mains are 6-10. I would recommend a chilli burger which comes with garlic fries - delicious! They also do some more unusual main courses with many dishes made to share. I also thought the wine list was great with a choice for every budget. Like other reviewers I think the service could be more attentive and you are often left to your own devices for lengthy periods before you order. That's fine if you are out for a gossip with the girls but not great if you are hungry!

hgN-f1UH_tkMJfkm-NCaaw.text: I have never been so humilated than the time when I ate at The Outsider. I was meeting a friend who I had not seen in ages, so we had loads to catch up on. We ate our way very slowly through our lunch as we chatted too much, and we were constantly interupted by staff asking if we needed anything, if we were finished. It became rather annoying. It was getting late, we had pudding and were deciding whether or not we should go somewhere else for a drink, we then opted for another bottle of wine at the restaurant. Again, every few mintues we were asked if we needed anything and we kept saying no. Then the waitress suddenly came and told us to leave and that we had been there long enough!!!! I was shocked at the tone and asked to see the manager who was even ruder!! He slouched over our table and told us that we had leave, we mentioned the fact that we had just ordered a bottle of win and his reply was that he could empty our glasses in the bottle and we could take it with us! We argued the fact that if they had wanted us to leave, then they should have told us before we ordered more wine. We were eventually given another table at the door, where we chatted more and then after about 20 minutes were told that enough was enough and we were to leave. We had spent about 70 there and were appalled at the behaviour of the staff. I will never be back and have to say the food portions in comparision to price was rather poor too. The manager's name was Matthew Kelly, and he really thought himself as something. Very, very poor show and an appalling way to treat paying customers!

FFOfLw8bu72_hl7ukpCO9w.text: First time in Scotland and the UK, saw the ratings on yelp and google and decided to try.   Casual and modern atmosphere - can get a bit loud during the busy lunch time!   Food is 5/5 for me. I got the lunch special - char grilled pork chop loin (?) and it was delicious! Price was around 6.8 pounds and plenty of food! I would say the dish is on the saltier side, but still very very delicious. The dish came with potatoes which were also perfect.   My wife got a linguini special that has crabs and the dish was full of that ocean/sea taste. It's like you're sitting at the beach- just in front of the ocean and then a little bit of paprika's spiciness brings that warmth of the beach sunshine.   Also got the bread for two and it was worth it. Three pieces of warm bread with butter and I believe it was pesto butter! Bread was crunchy and hard on the outside and soft inside. Perfect way to start our UK trip!   Recommend for lunch!!

_STtW0Axpa6L8VJe7Sd6Jw.text: We got seated on a Friday night with no reservation but it's probably a good idea to make a reservation. The space is very cool with some benches in nooks and an upstairs seating as well.   We started with the smoked Aubergine and buckwheat pancakes. It was fairly unique I admit but it worked pretty well. The aubergine was very flavourful and smoked well. The pancakes were fine but a bit plain I suppose.   I got the roast lamb rump with courgette cake. The lamb was good though rather fatty. But at least I could cut around the fat. The courgette cakes were actually a highlight of the dish. Very smooth, almost decadent flavour. I'd get the dish again but just wish there was less fat on the lamb - a meatier cut would be ideal.

photos.caption: Photo of The Outsider - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Smoked Aubergine &amp; Buckwheat Pancakes - unique and interesting, quite good

nwh9LPGSNbl0_38eeBXU6Q.text: If you go early, you can get in before the evening rush.  Friday night is a bear.  We sat on the mezzanine level which is supposedly more quiet than the main door.  We had actually made reservations earlier in the day. And when I asked if we could have a window table, we were told that he didn't have one, yet we watched one sit vacant the entire hour and half we were there.    Good initial service from a left handed waitress! Never came back to ask how it was.  But was prompt with the bill.  They are not paid a living wage but hourly based on age!  Be 21...  My partner ordered the delicious mussels and I tried the spicy lamb meatballs.  The Sauvignon Blanc was mediocre.  The food really is good, really good.  However, the management didn't even say goodbye or thank you for coming in on our anniversary.  Just stood there looking busy.  It doesn't seem like they care much about their operation.

mlo2Hq0LdCr0w2G18rVTxA.text: Loved the food and ambience! We lucked out with a view of the castle. Service was great and so friendly. Very cool vibe. I got the risotto with fish, and my husband got the mussels (the fries did seem like they had been picked up from McDonald's, but not a problem for my husband ha).

photos.caption: Photo of The Outsider - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. View of the castle from our table!

b764uD8JWstpOBj2UOUKIA.text: Had dinner at this trendy little restaurant just down from the Radisson Hotel at the recommendation of hotel staff. The menu is very eclectic and innovative. Prices are reasonable for the quality of food. Our meals were excellent with a nice gourmet edge. My gnocchi with squash, tomatoes and roasted walnuts served in a blue cheese cream sauce was lovely. My companions had the grilled chicken and prawn skewers with a beet salad stuffed pita that was great to look at and all reported it delicious! Plus the garlic fries are a "must try" too!  I'd recommend this restaurant to visitors to Edinburgh!

photos.caption: Photo of The Outsider - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of The Outsider - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

RXbgyGUno_sqBlRUj6hpnQ.text: Food is super yummy, service was attentive. Came in at opening without a reservation, and requested a seat with a view of the castle. They promptly seated us near the window.  A friend and I ordered three lunch dishes to share at around 6-7 each. Each dish was quite flavorful and cooked expertly. I don't remember what we ordered, but we enjoyed the duck and seafood dishes.  Lovely interior as well. Will definitely come back in the future.

fMk4S8QbDPUtJeOHx-X2lQ.text: Dont  know  what  is about, order  the same  dish as the  English gentleman sit by the  next table but get just half of the portion as his . it is ok to eat less and keep fit. But  It is unfair  to the  NON  ENGLISH speaker, that  is why  the  restaurant  is  name?    talked to the waiter but she is just laughing.they  don't  pay  attention  to your handsign and leave you waitting

photos.caption: Photo of The Outsider - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. venision
Photo of The Outsider - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. table
Photo of The Outsider - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. mussle

ZH-wWpchau2Ssdh2qrAHfg.text: Very good. One of the first restaurants I have tried here. Garlicky fries are excellent and not too overwhelming on the garlic flavor. The bread for two was excellent, a heaping portion for each. Excellent ambiance. Try if you are in the area.

qCZwBsk3PzTuCLvENac1ww.text: Had a solid first meal in Edinburgh here, but unfortunately the food was nothing special. My gnocchi was under seasoned, heavy, and chewy. My dining companion had a steak that he described as good, but not great. Tried some of the potato wedges and those were also lacking seasoning. Everything looked amazing, but did not stand up to a taste test. Still giving this place three stars for the wonderful drinks-- the special gin & tonic is delicious and well priced, and the wine I was recommended was tasty-- and the ambiance is really lovely for a date.

photos.caption: Photo of The Outsider - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Dinner menu

YfCAQZhLmwnwQ5jMsJCMfA.text: - best meal of my entire trip - friendly staff - pleasant/purposeful but not large wine and beer selection - reasonable pricing for quality of food - farm to table - recommend: venison - fantastic atmosphere; zero pretension; comfortable/cozy; airy  - great for dates, groups, really any occasion - if I lived in the area, this would be my weekly dinner spot - will definitely come again, highly recommended

Wa--cX-S_6xzNCdIiX1VoA.text: The food was average. I ordered the 35 day flatiron steak...while the meat was tender and the insides were pink, the outside was quite charred and imparted a burnt taste with every bite. The hand cut fries on the side were fine, tasted like potato but I didn't like the salad that came with the main. The salad was a bit bitter and too much red onion overwhelmed it.  Overall, very mediocre place. Nothing special about it, nothing particularly Scottish or British. And the most outrageous part was that despite mostly absent/mediocre service, they automatically add a 12% tip.   I would recommend skipping this place unless nowhere else is available.

Q45OTmJ7qnvWpB18sf-cKw.text: Maybe an off night?  Just not good, menu is weird,  service was terrible, we had our family of 4 adults and 3 kids One meal came ages at end and we asked if we could get it put in a take out container and were told they could not do it, some silly rule or law  Was not a busy night either  Since we were visiting, I guess we wont be overly bothered but we went because it was recommended by our apartment owner  Way many more eating spots to try

qacPPLIae50BsC6GncLJuQ.text: What started out as a great dinner gradually fell into shambles. Arrived on time and ordered prosecco for the table and then a bottle of wine and cheese plate. It came quickly and was pretty good. Then we ordered and we waited and waited and waited and then were surprised when the wine finished and the food wasn't there and then we counted the time. When the waitress starts ignoring you or when you see her in the back waiting, you know something is wrong. Food finally comes, gnocchi doesn't take an hour. We would've asked why it took so long but she ignored us when we kept trying to ask why dinner took so long. Part of the order is wrong.   "Oh we can make it for you right away!"   Right, but the first batch took an hour?  We ask for the check and for boxes.   "Oh we don't do carry out"   (most places here don't, we were naive/hopeful)  Fine. We haven't touched our food. Can we have the check?  10 minutes later, they give us check. We have to wait for them to come back to provide payment.  Eventually We had our gnocchi wrapped in aluminum foil and we gave it to someone who looked hungry outside. No offer of sorry or asking why or anything. Basically nothing from the staff.   I really liked everything else about Edinburgh.

0zQXCwyW_Ac-OAjIAt5ubA.text: Excellent service and ambiance.   The mgr / waiter was outstanding.  Definitely a must go !!!

LPh8tj4NLqXjXjaUeSOGDg.text: The good: Very nice setting and trendy decorated. Great location and away from touristy areas.   The bad: The staff are not really friendly. To the point, when my wine arrived I picked up the unused glass to make room in front of me. The waiter responded to me - since I touched it they have sterilize it again. I mean really.   Secondly, although to food options on the menu seem great, the food we had were very bland and not seasoned to compliment the meat.   I will probably not return.

ZHeMB_DjzMistZi59Oen7Q.text: No thanks - dont go there!   We wanted to celebrate our last evening here, and were happy to get a table, with a same day reservation. The location is okay, lets call it modern - at least we didnt feel underdressed ;-)   We arrived at 9 and ordered at 9:15 - the bread came fast, but the starter (pork cheeks with lentils) took 30 minutes... unfortunately it was really mediocre, not to say boring in taste... after that we had to wait whooping 30 minutes more... when serving the large group of people next to us (who ordered AFTER us), the waitress told us to check where our food was, but you could tell from the look she gave us, she couldn't care less...  So the food arrived, with a decent delay between the two of us, my rib eye was of poor quality and burnt - with no salt. Nice one, if you have to ask for salt and wait another five minutes. And instead of grilled vegetables, I had baked potates.. what a mess.   Matching this screwed up eevning the waitress had added 12% tip on the bill, even though the menu said it is only added for tables of 5 and larger...   What a waist of time money and calories...

hT9Sm3wWzxmqf3V6ShD8aA.text: No trip to edinburgh without visiting The Outsider. The Lunch menu is a total for both price and flavour. We tried the black garlic and maple tempeh and it's surprisingly filling!  We paid 23 for two main course and two glasses of house wine!  Can't wait for my next visit!

photos.caption: Photo of The Outsider - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

66TfExRhe07Yd9sFyeZmbA.text: Love the service, lovely waitress made the day, but above all, best food we've had in our time in Edinburgh and that's no exaggeration! Combined with the price, I cannot think of a better place! Great great value!  Loved the lamb rump curry, great rabbit pie and braced leek!  Certainly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of The Outsider - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of The Outsider - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of The Outsider - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

osQcZJWdxPu7YO8NFomFRw.text: Nice decor but it took 25 min to put our food to our table, stone bass and risotto. And the risotto is really mild, as if they forgot to put the salt. What bothers me is the waiter Paul said, it's not fast food, it takes time to cook. Did they went out and fish for the stone bass?

photos.caption: Photo of The Outsider - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

zOcOJepBHQWicmJlJJzE0g.text: Recommended to dine here by our 94DR B&B host, my mom and I decided to do so. We arrived well after lunch around 3ish so it was easy to get a table. We were immediately seated with a view of the castle. Very dreamy. Service was attentive and friendly. We ordered the mussels with fries and gnocchi. We were also given fresh baked bread along with olives. Order a few pints too. Everything was fresh and exceptional. For lunch, the portions were very generous. To be honest, we could not believe our receipt total as it was a tremendous value for such an amazing meal. Overall I highly recommend and when I return to Edinburgh, definitely returning.

photos.caption: Photo of The Outsider - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of The Outsider - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of The Outsider - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

YyzqXmRWyZsebhMYpkgukQ.text: I would agree with some of the other comments here. The restaurant is nice, decor is impressive and it is very cosy and warm. The place looks welcoming from outside. The food has always been good - I think I have been 2 or 3 times now.   What lets this restaurant down is the service. They are a bit obsessive about taking your coats off you - my husband always keeps his wallet in his coat so doesn't like giving it up - the staff were quite embarassing in their insistance. The service is not friendly or timely. The manager has had stand up rows with diners while I was there too.   Other friends have had bad experiences both here and more so at the Apartment (the sister restaurant).   In the apartment one set of friends were told that they would have to leave if the hen put on a veil she had been given. Another set of friends were treated very shabbily because they were on a fancy dress night out.   Won't be going back - a shame cos food is good but they seem to think that they are better than their customers.

aLXL80PlcZjhV3SnKXM_5g.text: A very nice restaurant that comfortably treads that slightly awkward line between being smart and casual. And it's most notable for its outstanding views of the castle. Ask for a table near the back window if you wish to impress.   The food is great. Lunch is excellent value. Dinner is a bit more expensive but you kind of expect that given the location and the nature of the place. And it's varied, tasty, imaginately put together, great wine list. Everything you'd expect from a smart but casual place in the middle of Edinburgh.   The Outsider is very unlikely to disappoint.

ZyXMm4YioSKAnuY1GfFTxw.text: Service was really quick and efficient. We had the duck and it was a bit tasteless. Beautiful location however we didn't get a table with a view. Had young families and old couples a like having dinner. Definitely worth having a look at as the area is lovely, in the Old Town.

AGATpeELVXGX2w3qrNBUSw.text: Excellent restaurant. Consistent quality. Buzzy informal atmosphere.

ir0rmYuyHPDkcYMrMY939g.text: One of the better places to eat in the city. Quality food and amazing views of the castle. I have found the caliber of beef in Scotland to be a bit suspect, but the steak sandwich here was incredible. The service was also very friendly.

nvDFUke36GIWUtXRpQ0Yhg.text: I went to The Outsider last Saturday for an early dinner. I phoned ahead and booked a castle view table, which didn't disappoint, having lived in Edinburgh for many years I was still very impressed by the view. I got the skirt steak and chips which was cooked perfectly, we tried all the 3 smaller starters on the menu  the pig cheeks were probably the best of the three. All four of us really enjoyed the meal and the restaurant had a really nice atmosphere. I would definitely recommend  also great place to take friends visiting Edinburgh!

WB-oWZpVzEs3Og9wuRwNeQ.text: Happy Tourists!  Just in town for one afternoon/night, we came here on the recommendation of the Hotel Missoni bellman.  Great recommendation.  He suggested we come early for a table with view of Edinburgh Castle, and we were seated right near the window.  Delicious, crusty yet soft-centered bread with pesto for dipping. They have "lunch" specials till 5 p.m. We arrived just before that, not by design, and lingered over our drinks and dinner for nearly two hours, but didn't feel at all hurried by the waitstaff despite our prime window spot for two.  We squeezed in a lunch order of sea bass just before 5 to share as a starter (delicious) with a nice pinot grigio, then shared a dinner (because we weren't in a rush to decide, and so many things sounded good!) main course of puisson stuffed with couscous and accompanied by hand-cut chips, along with a side of risotto (not on the menu as a side item, but they accommodated us).  Very nice staff and ambiance, loved the view, and the food and wine were great. We didn't have dessert because we were too full, but the offerings sounded intriguing--figs, polenta cake, etc.  Lunch prices are very affordable--fresh sea bass for 7 pounds, for example.  If we get back to Edinburgh, we'll make a it a point to visit again.

DnhXIAWBVrCeTGInGBJRBw.text: I have been passing this restaurant frequently. It seems always busy. Finally, my friends' visit gave me an excuse to try it out. It was their last night in town, so I was happy to discover the food was really delicious, the view of the castle spectacular, and the whole experience - memorable. On the downside - the noise level was a bit high, which is my overall complaint with so many places in the UK. How one is supposed to have a meaningful conversation when it is hard to hear your own thoughts? I guess you end up shouting more, which just adds to the noise level.

gBgbk9qbsTcDkcdrarmQfQ.text: This is a wonderful restaurant - the atmosphere and staff are warm and inviting. I loved every minute of our evening. The food is very good, the menu is diverse and the wine list is interesting. The only problem is that it isn't very vegetarian friendly - there are a few options, but it's very limited (not unusual for Edinburgh). But even that being the case, my vegetarian friend and I had a brilliant time and will be going again!

4zbSgkhxC3uLCPcsOUppkQ.text: Fantastic meal and interesting menu.  I would be happy to return here next time I'm in Edinburgh.

YWZMZWBAzx0p7z9HqAKb4g.text: I think the outsider is a great little restaurant; Lunch is particularly good as the prices are much more reasonable than in the evening. The service can be a bit slow/sloppy when it's busy, but for a large space it feels intimate and the wine list is fantastic.

3PoxMpbCdKAMAXZK6PvGCw.text: I was recommended The Outsider by a friend and thought I would check it out. It is a nicely decorated restaurant. Modern, but not standoffish. The food was quite good to meI would recommend you get a side of sweet potatoes if you go, as they were the best. And, the food was not very pricey (11-15 per main course). The view was nicehuge windows that look out at the castle. The service was awful. The staff seemed to just forget about my table, and didn't come take our food or drink order for about 20 minutes. They seemed to be in their own little world, snacking (yes, eating) and chatting in the kitchen/bar area. When they did help us, they were friendly. The service really was the only part I did not enjoy, but the food was so wonderful that I would go back again.

mCzYCd6yQmaSzxwDBUChCQ.text: I went here for a family lunch one day and the food was pretty good. Ample portions and tasty. the chips in particular are fabulous, especially the garlic chips. The desserts are also rather yummy!

oxOgfX1eEZee5jGh0DeDhw.text: There are no starters in The Outsider, you chose one of the main courses between two or three of you then a main course too. This is a novel idea as I know that I have so many times looked at a menu and thought I want more than one of the mains! The whole restaurant is spacious and gorgiously designed too.

DyqK63ehjTdULgqlUZFo9A.text: What a fantastic meal! You absolutely have to make the effort to have a meal out here, at least once, I have seldom had a really good dinner that I've raved about quite so much. We went here for a work night out well in advance of xmas and it was brilliant! The food is unusual without being so far out there that you don't know what you're getting. And it was utterly delicious. A lot of the meals are made for sharing (ideal for a romantic dinner for two!) and the atmosphere was very relaxed and informal. The waiting staff were polite although could have done with being a little more friendly.

NapPCoPT_wuKOTyd6RtFgw.text: Great place for a tasty bit of lunch, the mussels with bacon, cream, and pinenuts was excellent. Funky interior and good service.

0RKilBg3m-I7D8hqLLLS5Q.text: Sister restaurant to the Apartment, the Outsider has a similar menu and 'no starter but share a main' philosophy. The food is lovely, but it can get very busy here during the summer. The upside to this is that if you request a window table when you book you get a stunning view of the castle and the fireworks. This is a very romantic setting, but also good for larger groups too. The menu is well put together and the wine list is great.

80uElVImS3jKFeJvIl-Bqw.text: I've eaten here a few times and really enjoyed it. It's a lovely venue which is modernly decorated, very cool and if your lucky enough to have a view of the castle - quite spectacular. The menu is good, with a decent selection, last time I was there I had sea-bass and it was a lovely fresh, filling choice. They have a well stocked wine list and fantastic cocktails.  This is a great restaurant for an intimate meal, but also caters well for large groups.

gm-7E5W_8qEcru1Vi50shQ.text: The food here is AMAZING. Like, really really good. It can be a bit pricey, but you can beat that by going at lunch time. My flatmate swears by the steak sandwich, and I loved the mussels with bacon, cream, and pinenuts. Wow, my mouth's watering right now Maybe it's time for an early lunch   The interior is relaxed, and there are lovely views from the Castle out of the back windows. The staff are a good laugh.   I'd book if you've got your heart set on it - it tends to fill up!

mXfC3YUVEJZEN9_d2zlIPQ.text: The food here is great and afforadble for a great meal out. The atmosphere is classy and the service and staff are lovely. You get a great view of the castle from the upper floor which complements the whole experience. It has some lovely paintings aswell. Heres an interesting idea: As you walk down the stairs to the bathrooms check out the tiny painting on the wall down by the floor which is sideways?? It always grabs my attension.

n7cxesoJj0RtV7QIE2E4lQ.text: A great gem of a restaurant in the city centre. Really excellent (and for lunch great priced) food. The Outsider is upscale casual meets modern European at it's best. Sure it's a bit overly crowded (there probably should be 20% fewer tables), but the service is spot on the food was among the best I had whilst up in Edinburgh. Great location too right on George IV bridge.  As for what to order, the chunky healthy lines are massive, great if you are starving. I had the chili beef salad which was very well prepared and tasty. My friend's sea bass was elegantly presented.  Even though they charge extra for bread, it's worth the 90p splurge as the bread is freshly baked and really delicious. The lunch specials were all reasonable with most mains in the 6 to 8 pound range.  Next time I am definitely ordering one of their burgers. They look amazing!

hU5H6A-jsPaoFvZm1lmhRw.text: I'm not sure I know what "modern European cuisine" means, but if this is it, I am a fan.  Close to the Grassmarket, but away from the tourists, this is a handsome restaurant with a great view of the castle from the back windows.  My son and I split the skewers for an appetizer.  Then he had a skirt steak and I had fish.  Add a couple of Innkill & Gunn beers, excellent service, and a cozy atmosphere, and we had a great first night in Edinburgh.  We liked it so well that we went to the Apartment Bistro, run by the same proprietor, a couple of nights later.

AshnvIPsyk-k6oBmotsmXw.text: Delicious food ! The specials change and are really unique and tasty. They say it's all local , which is great. Really nice atmosphere ! Potions aren't huge but great Great lunch prices and perfect size for lunch! Defiantly coming  back

photos.caption: Photo of The Outsider - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Delicious Gnocchi and side salad
Photo of The Outsider - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Little fish and ratatouille

EijG6Y1aAZlFmos5OQc4GQ.text: The outside is a great place to grab a delicious meal and an amazing view of the castle. The service is great and very friendly staff. We got the CHL (or whatever they are called) for an app which was delicious! My boyfriend got the steak, which he said was just OK. I got the muscles that where in this creamy bacon sauce which was very very good! We enjoyed ourselves!

5VDS5DBL5f2RwRKtZDUO5w.text: This restaurant has a casual yet sophisticated vibe to it. If you are lucky enough to get a seat near the windows you will have an amazing view of the Edinburgh castle.   Hubby and I went for an early dinner and were able to take advantage of a special for Duck confit with squash puree as well as a prawn and salmon salad. We also ordered a side of garlic fries which were really yummy. I found the rest of the menu a bit limited and would have probably rather tried the lunch offerings but we missed the service time for that.  Tip: if the pudding menu doesn't tickle your fancy head down the road to the Vittoria* Gelato/Ice cream window *Thanks to Jenny L. for the reminder on name of the place =)

photos.caption: Photo of The Outsider - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of The Outsider - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Duck Confit
Photo of The Outsider - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. View of castle

ZmjJeF40dCp979p486N-aQ.text: This restaurant has always stopped me in my path, pulling me in to peer through the window. I don't know what it is about The Outsider but I'm glad I finally had the opportunity to eat here this week!   Boy it took me a while to decide on what to eat. I wanted everything! My chicken and prawn kebabs in a peanut and lime chili sauce accompanied by salad and apple and beetroot coleslaw tucked inside pitta bread from the Chunky Healthy Lines menu was sooo tasty  and filling!   I really shouldn't have had dessert but when I saw the tray with poached pear in plum sauce and pot of chocolate moose being carried to another table, I was having what she was having! It was heaven!  This is my new favourite restaurant. I love the decor and lighting, the staff are friendly and the menu offers reasonably priced, fantastic dishes! Now to work my way down the list of choices...

HQeGPBC5cLcPo5bLWuKsDw.text: One of Edinburgh great opinion-dividing restaurants, The Outsider is a love or hate place, as shown by the reviews, here. The view Edinburgh Castle is impressive, so it's a good daylight dining choice. The lunch is competitively priced. It's very popular, so a booking is required. But it all felt rather passe, to me, and both dishes that I had looked rather better than they tasted.  Overall, we said: "I didn't have a particularly strong reaction, for or against the place. My abiding impression was of a restaurant that was a well-worn favourite for many of its patrons, with all the positive and negative connotations that that brings. The owners and staff members know what they're doing, and they're very comfortable with delivering it, but it felt like a place that had been trapped in aspic for a little too long. But if it ain't broke, don't fix it, as they say, and based on the crowded restaurant they had, today, their model still strongly appeals."

jqb0M4V9XxZp8bS9OP2AGA.text: Beautiful atmosphere. Over looks Edinburgh Castle from the back. Great place for lunch and dinner. Prices are very affordable and the food is great quality. Would definitely return.

KGyQ5_wxFYCLuob_m5cqaA.text: This restaurant is absolutely stunning. To begin with the staff were friendly and attentive. We welcomed and briskly seated. As my partner and I are both vegetarians it's always easy finding somewhere suitable to eat out. However the restaurant had a good choice of vegetarian options. Not only that but the waitress suggested to modify some of the dishes on the menu to meet our needs. The main courses were attractively presented and the combination of flavours was exquisite! Unfortunately we're too stuffed to try anything from the pudding menu. So there will have to be a return visit. I would recommend to reserve a table in advance to take advantage of a having a window seat offering you the beautiful of the castle.

8qWCR4nzg7oxyc6Uc6zSZA.text: We stopped in here after reading up on the Yelp suggestions. The reviews we mixed and I'll admit our is as well. The chorizo and squid salad was good but we found it missing something. The squid didn't absorb the great taste of the chorizo. Too bad because the sausage is really tasty. My main was the lamb and feta balls. I really liked it but love the taste of lamb. Sandra was less of a fan. Her sea bass and scallops was good but lacked enough sauce to make it all the way through the meal. In the end, the tastes were really good but each meal was about 90% of perfect.

5m1H7kcyLJYhazoWyIqOWA.text: The reasons I have fallen hook, line and sinker for The Outsider:  It's a neighbourhood restaurant where locals and families go to eat. It's opposite one of my favourite bars and pre-club venues - Villager. It's decorated tastefully with rustic wooden tables, patterned cushions and hints of colour. It has a private booth that seats four to six. It has breathtaking views of the Castle. It has a fab wine-list including one of the most beautiful and berrylicious Shiraz I've ever drunk. It serves totally delicious food - my favourite dish being the grilled hallumi kebabs with pitta, coleslaw and salad. It has sugar-rushing deserts that match the flavour and intensity of the wine.  It has friendly and efficient staff that don't mind if you stay one hour or three.  It's named after Albert Camus's classic existential masterpiece.*    *If it isn't named after Albert Camus's novel, it probably takes its name from Francis Ford Coppola's equally awesome 80s movie.

oTcV1_b1CdhS0CmjpNkotw.text: This was the second best meal that we had on our 31 day trip around the UK and Spain (the absolute best was the restaurant inside the Bilbao Guggenheim museum).  I suppose it's odd to start out with saying that this was a "second best" meal, because honestly, I still think about the fish I had at The Outsider--it was perfect!  It was both attractive and delicious and creative (there were sea vegetables decorating the outside of the dish that perfectly complimented the fish--and it was nice to look at).  My husband had the pigeon, which was also yummy, and we split a salad to start and the plum tart to finish.  We also had a wonderful view of the castle (and our waitress was nice enough to take a photo of us with the castle in the background).  We liked this restaurant so much that we were tempted to just eat here throughout our stay in Edinburgh.  Although we had other nice meals, this was, by far, the best in Edinburgh and the best meal we had in the 2 weeks we were in the UK (including time in London).

1w8OrQb_2GA4fXKeBuYIuA.text: Pretty much any time someone asks me where they should eat in Edinburgh, I say The Outsider. For lunch, for dinner - it's perfect. The food's always great, the staff are lovely, and the venue is elegant and has great views over the rooftops to the castle. We sat at a window seat the first time we went, and I think it was love at first lunch - I've just hooked on the place ever since.   I've been there for work, with friends, with family - and regularly for lunch with Jason when we're in town. I'll confess I do order the mussels 98% of the time, because they're amazing, but I have tried other options and it's always good! At lunch there are specials, plus a list of eight-or-so regular options, all reasonably priced. In the evening, it's fun to start with the chunky skewers to share. And do get the bread and olives - giant, luscious olives and hefty chunks of bread.   I'm hungry now....

KKY7Klg7f0dz4Y6_c_dy-w.text: Disclaimer: we did not actually eat here. We showed up on a Thursday evening without a reservation and asked if it would be possible to get a table for two. We were seated but told we only had an hour until the table's next reservation, which we understood. We did not order drinks but when the waitress asked for our orders, we asked for a starter salad to split. The waitress told us rather harshly that we were not allowed to order a starter due to the time constraint. We ended up leaving and found a nearby restaurant that was able to serve us a starter, entrees, and a dessert in a similar time constraint. Perhaps the food is good but don't expect to be treated with respect here if you do not have a reservation.

Djrg1-t_ScPBjrTvLtslqA.text: We ate here during our first night in Edinburgh. We selected it because the Yelp reviews were very good and it was close to our accommodations.  It is a very pretty restaurant.  The menu had interesting choices and there were several items to satisfy the diverse tastes of my group.  The service was a bit slow and our server was forgetful but friendly.  We had questions about the menu and she was unfamiliar with specifics and "meant" to ask the chef.  After we got tired of waiting for the answers, we just ordered.  The two starters we shared were great, goat cheese profiteroles and pea soup with ham roulette.  The mains were underwhelming.  If you like real gnocchi, this selection is not what you would expect.  The gnocchi was sliced rectangle of  "pasta" of a similar consistency as gnocchi but not as good. My husband had the chicken and prawn skewers which he said were "okay".  My daughter had the sea bream which was delicious.  The restaurant was very accommodating for special requests for food allergies.

d5QNAWhkgo3e55h7SD4HLg.text: Came in for dinner last week with a buddy of mine as I knew that it was a solid eaterie, plus his wife thing (she's lovely really) is allergic to (get this) apples, pears, strawberries, other berries, snozberries, most other fruit, tomatos, grapes (so no wine) and of course lactose. She can have Gluten and nuts which makes me think she might just be crazy. Her favourite meal in the world is pizza but it might kill her....  Anyway,  we had to find someone that wasn't too "tomato-ee" for her.  This was a good bet.  The chunky healthy lines made a great starter for me and man-friend, and a great main for wife-thing. The rustic bread and olive oil we got with it was delightful.   My mail was some coley and frankly a nicer piece of fish I have never had. My only slight complaint was that the salad and potato that came with it were a bit frugal. The piece of fish was a bit wee as well (if utterly delicious) which basically is a bit upsetting when a chunky healthy line is HUGE and cost 3 less!  Anyway it was a great experience. Staff were great and helpful and nice.  We enjoyed it and my mates wife didn't die.  Solid.

BlFEm2Mit7LXU-YBs1N4Gw.text: I trusted a review on Yelp that said this place was flexible with vegan options which was important to my daughter.  Yelp was mistaken.  THERE ARE NO VEGAN OPTIONS HERE except "garlicky French fries" and bread.  The waitress offered nothing by way of creating ANYTHING my daughter could eat, save for a salad or removing the meats from skewer dishes.  Calling to make a reservation was difficult as I was asked to hold the line for 5 minutes at a time and then hung up on.  Twice.  Table service was slow, had to repeatedly ask for parts of order that had been forgotten (including the bread which was half my daughter's meal).  The fish I ate was well prepared and tasty but all in all this was not a pleasant eating experience for me and my family.

G7BKbu-rSRBumXhR9FnWVQ.text: In my 7 years of living in Edinburgh i had always been meaning to visit The Outsider but never quite got around to it, until this weekend. My Dad was visiting me and so took me out for lunch, perfect opportunity.  The staff were very friendly, if anything a little too laid back, but can't complain. The menu all sounded delicious and i opted for the salmon fishcake served with mussels (only 3 but still good) and a poached egg on top, i would definitely have this again. My Dad had an aubergine based dish which was also delicious and we shared a side of garlicky fries.  The feel of the restaurant is very contemporary and chilled out. Although it was pretty chilly in there so next time i might wrap up a bit.  To finish my Dad had a passion fruit tart with rhubarb, obviously i trid some then regretted not getting one myself. I had a cappuccino which was sprinkled with shaved chocolate, always a good sign in my book.  I will definitely be back here again soon! :)

AgiFBfFWmfNhQsTpZ8-Deg.text: I find myself always slowing when I walk past this place as I used to be SO intrigued by it?! What looks like an apparently 'nameless' restaurant on George IV Bridge....... with a lovely chalk lunch menu outside and what looks like a lovely air-y space inside.  I ended up *finally* getting to go to the Outsider as a wee treat before leaving Edinburgh, and I gotta say it was the perfect choice!!! This place is elegant but laid back, the food has a good modern twist but it presented a little slap-dash and slightly rustic which I quite liked. The service is friendly and I found myself wishing I had come here more before leaving!  My Pigeon with Serrano Ham with a mix of beans and beetroot salsa was heavenly!!!? I only wish I had been a little more hungry and had some starter and dessert! From what I can gather the menu seems to change very frequently which I think is fab. I would definitely go again for dinner and I have heard that the lunch offer is ace!

rNi1ig-mSDu-lhIevR---Q.text: Popped in for lunch - very pleased we did. Comfortable, friendly setting for a nice meal. Menu was appealing all around - my lamb special was spot on.

5n9sU6LzeESB3x8oBAMu6w.text: Went to this restaurant on a Saturday night. It was busy, but service was very friendly and accommodating.  I ordered the flat iron steak, which was beautiful and just what I wanted. Portions can be large, but never oversized. They had a nice wine selection and my friends had great things to say about the pigeon starter and the seabream and venison mains. Dessert was exicitng and innovative. We were complimenting the food the entire night!  Beautiful ambiance. Would definitely like to go back!

kvU002uj0IJHaTDVzawVxQ.text: We stayed in Edinburgh for 5 days and this was the place everyone agreed was their favorite. The food was amazing and it was an adorable place. We got a great table that was very private and still had an amazing view of the castle, the service was great our waiter was super helpful and attentive. The cheese plate and break and olives were the perfect starter with our wine and the ribeye was cooked perfectly. You also need to try the espresso cake it's life changing. Totally recommend!!!

RQAATh-h_ZPjLDOeu0CW7Q.text: We visited The Outsider by recommendation from a local. Wonderful spot: elegant, great views of the castle, incredible food and wine at affordable prices (we had the gnocchi). Don't miss this!

7njQ74SQwjW0MruJPrVJOQ.text: Tried to come here for lunch... Apple maps took us effectively 50 feet below! Gave up. After evening church, we tried again... This time with Waze!... Perseverance paid off. Service splendid. Lovely wine. All four of us had tremendous mains. The dessert was great, and capped nicely with Macallan.

PTVX50L7Np1ATeyXtKSgyw.text: This was the most amazing meal. The service was great, speedy and friendly. The fried gnocchi had the most amazing mixed flavor of savory and orange sweet. The sea bram was delicious as was the Moroccan veggies. The chocolate espresso dessert with molasses ice cream was the perfect way to end the meal. We all thought is was just a bit better than the Witchery where we ate last night. This is a not to miss place. Reservations are probably best although we got in without one. It was just very busy and we got lucky. Enjoy.

C0n3Ki7eAnqqSiCQvCeDVg.text: A few months ago, when I was living in Edinburgh, I went to The Outsider for lunch after walking by and seeing their chalkboard menu from outside. Deciding that I liked both the price and the selection (and their kir royale drink special), I went in on a whim. It was a few minutes before noon, and the restaurant was very quiet. I ordered the kir royale I was hankering for, and a lentil and goat cheese salad. Shortly after, the restaurant began filling up with other patrons who also seemed to enjoy a lunchtime drink. The noise level rose, but not to an overwhelming level, and I was soon placated when my food came.   I admit that I've never had a better salad. There were perfectly cooked lentils, briny, creamy goat cheese bits, and delicious crunchy greens in a light vinaigrette. The kir royale was also lovely. I escaped with only an 12 pound bill, and decided that I would return soon.  Not one to break my word, I have returned two times since, once for the venison ravioli, which was a little bloodier tasting than I would have liked, and once for the baked gnocchi with pesto, which did not disappoint.   I would highly recommend The Outsider for lunch. Their lunch menu is reasonably priced, and the food quality is excellent.

photos.caption: Photo of The Outsider - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Goat cheese and lentil salad.

wdjfkV5a6gsbn-P6IsTJhg.text: 15-16 George IV Bridge, EH1 1EE. Lamb rump with the perfect au jus and duck leg with wilted greens and pumpkin; seasonal, juicy, and always busy (reserve a table ahead of time if you can + 0131 226 3131). It is one of those places that does not advertise (no website), but delightfully romantic and lively atmosphere with real wax candles dripping from wooden blocks and the most delicious chunky bread to start from a bakery called DoughReMi.  Emily Rose Reeder

Pxpu0IOq4gpRPsuPrHDXDA.text: Informal yet classy, just like moi. Central location on George IV Bridge, reasonably priced food with a nicely balanced menu, stylish but comfortable interior . . . I really cannot find anything wrong with this place.  I try to divide my luncheon life between Treacle and the Outsider, with the occasional sidestep to Dogs or even a shimmy towards somewhere else, but pretty much these three places have it covered, depending on the end of town in which you find yourself.  If you're lucky they'll give you a table in the window with a view across the Old Town. Lovely spot to drink some wine and enjoy the food. I mostly go for lunch but when I've gone for dinner I always start with the large skewers which are good for sharing. Monkfish and bacon skewers are always popular. In fact the general mix of dishes makes it a great place to bring guests. It's always top of my list to recommend to visitors.  And would you Adam and Eve it but they possibly do the best burger in town. I always say I'm not going to get the burger as the place is too stylish to order such a declasse dish, but their chilli burger with gruyere cheese is fantastic.  I do have one gripe in that they don't have an online menu, or indeed a website (a cardinal sin in my book), but I forgive them. While the menu changes, I know the standards just about by heart. Well, it's not that difficult to memorise "Chilli burger and a beer, please. And can I have the table in the window?"

photos.caption: Photo of The Outsider - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Char-grilled pork chop with new potatoes, Savoy cabbage and peppers.

tKISW5CsFifHZSSqNZzGYQ.text: The outsider is a pretty trendy restaurant situated on George Aye Vee Bridge. Pretty trendy, but never style over substance by the looks of things. From one visit I deduce they have a competitively priced guest wine of the day, pencilled into the list much like a food special (has anyone been two days in a row to verify if this is legit?!). The evening I went it was a lovely Viognier, a carafe of which was expertly and effortlessly dispatched.  But I'm getting slightly ahead of myself...   Considering that the booking was made a generous two-an'-an-odd-bit weeks ahead, and that they have tables with castle views, we were really disappointed to be tucked away at a dinky little table in the corner of the mezzanine level. Butted up against the wall, our view consisted of the diners downstairs through a glass partition.  I had a starter of portabello mushroom with an exotic cheese I hadn't heard of (and neither had the waitress, but who other than that was knowledgeable and attentive). It was OK, the mushroom had been fired directly on the hob presumably and at any rate tasted a little of gas.  My main of roast lamb however was absolutely gorgeous. Caramelised on the outside, melt-in-the-mouth on the inside (pretty pink mind, but that was fine by me). The accompaniments were spot on too.  The way they've done the menu is quirky but not sure I would go as far as to label this place an 'outsider' of the trade. But for gastronauts or those out to impress a date it is definitely worth a visit.

rZbt0LRwSj3o-1AX8KDATQ.text: I don't see how anyone could give this restaurant anything less than a 5 star rating. We were there for lunch and our meals were outstanding. The ambience was great and the value for the money was unbelievable for this upper end of gastronomy cooking. Probably the best meal in the two weeks visiting the UK including dinners.

2ers7Em-cm4BhP6P_fziGg.text: This is an average restaurant.  Service:  slow and indifferent.  Would give service 2 stars.  Food:  Had Hake risotto.  Hake was over cooked and somewhat dry.  Risotto was flavorless.  Came with bok choi which was fiberous and not edible.  Portion was generous.  Food gets 3 stars.  Ambience:  4 stars.  Low lighting is nice and don't have to compete against music.

c0aIva7NYxy2gxU-88IaDg.text: What a delightful restaurant in Edinburgh.  The food was very inventive.  I had the Seafood Stew and my husband had the Sea Bass.  Both entrees while having familiar names had inventive flavored we loved it.  The high ceilings and Windows, creative lighting all served to enhance our experience.  The drinks menu was varied and complete.  The clientele ran the gamut of what you might expect in any metropolitan city.  All in all a wonderful experience for a visitor.  Well worth the price paid.

LYSbxrrzgpL7RZMY4sgxNA.text: I was looking for a restaurant reviewed by a Yelp friend when the clouds opened up and I ran into the nearest doorway only to find myself in The Outsider, the restaurant I was looking for in the first place.    The host was super friendly and seated me in the loft upstairs which boasts terrific views up the to castle.  I ordered grilled mackerel from the daily set menu.  It came with a rocket (arugula) salad and other nice, fresh veg.  I have been a little wary about mackerel in the past, expecting a strong, oily fish but this one was flavourful with a nice crispy skin.  Service from Ms. Emma was quick and friendly and I was able to enjoy my meal in less than an hour and get out to an early evening Fringe show.

FfVT0x2y0aJckfm8dseslQ.text: Food was good, desserts were delicious.  Pretty busy with limited wait staff.  View is excellent, especially at night when the castle is lit.  I believe steaks are graded differently in the US, our ribeye would certainly not qualify in US standards.

cmdQTzmIPeKz-XE_eHXXIg.text: Love this spot. It is my go-to when out of town guests are visiting. Dinner will run you about 25-30/pp, but if you are looking for a bargain go for lunch. Lunch tends to be under 10, and always under 15. Really good quality food, attentively prepared, thoughtfully presented, great Castle views, simple-classic dining atmosphere.

JI_sVCZBFu-MBhv53nx7ww.text: Great food, a nice vibe, and a staff that went out of their way to accomodate us - twice! First time we went and didn't have a reservation (recommended) but they fit us in at a very busy time. Next visit, we showed up on time but met up with 2 friends there who had a reservation for an hour later. Could they get us all in at the same time at the same table? Yes! Really liked the food and the presentation. The cheese with the crusty bread (app) was wonderful as were the olives.

o-uNeFLh2sD5bxyOcC3B6A.text: Very decent food with fabulous atmosphere. Perhaps slightly over-minimalist, but that's not the end of the world. The food is good -- if not fabulous -- but nothings' bad at all.   The downside is really inconsistent portion size. Some of the meals will leave you hungry while others are seriously overstuffing.   Is it niggly? a bit, but the portion sizes are really varied -- some of the lunch mains should really be called starters.

uKK7CLTRT40YppGXrhQfaw.text: An excellent view from the window to the castle while sipping wine and having beautiful food. That was the feeling I had when I was there! A beautiful place especially if you book in advance.

iVQIAm-yjiqbf3T6mie37Q.text: Beautiful location. If you are lucky enough to sit by the window you'll get a view of the castle. The service is very slow however. But this may be consistent to the European, no rush, way. This was not the only restaurant that was slow in this city. The food, however, was delicious. Very pleased!

photos.caption: Photo of The Outsider - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Steak ciabatta
Photo of The Outsider - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Beet burger

LKMHPm1EH7LL5l33Cp2_kQ.text: A little loud, but super friendly staff and yummy food, not to mention the great view of the castle. Check it out at sundown.
